body: Greetings from *Student Alumni Relations Cell*! We understand that Batch Snaps and the Yearbook are an integral part of every BITSian=E2=80=99s Life and capture the nostalgic memories of the grad= uating batch. The eventful years spent on the campus with seniors, batchmates and juniors turn into lifelong friendships. The Yearbook and Photos are what capture these memories for years to come. Traditionally, the Batch Snaps are held in the second semester of your pre-final year. However, due to COVID, they were not organized for the past two years. With things being normalized and students back on campus, the Student Alumni Relations Cell is elated to announce that we are organizing the Batch Snaps for FD Batch of 2018 (Single Degree and Dual Degree Students), HD Batch of 2020 and MBA Batch of 2020, tentatively on 19th, 20th and 21st November 2021 (Friday, Saturday and Sunday). This has been planned after extensive discussion and proper permissions from the administration and Director. According to your branch, they will be organized in slots, and every student participating in the Batch Snaps will have to *strictly follow all mandated guidelines*. A comprehensive document will be soon shared with detailed instructions, guidelines and schedule. This mail has been sent so that students can plan their leaves accordingly if they wish to participate in the Batch Snaps. The snaps will be organized on the dates mentioned above unless communicated otherwise due to unavoidable circumstances. Please note that you would be only allowed to enter the venue in your designated slots, and this will be organized just for the students of the graduating batch who are on campus. We are aware that some 2018 FD Single Degree Students are on PS-2. For such students, we would probably organize them next semester if the conditions allow. Please find attached a Document < =3Dsharing> with some frequently asked questions. We encourage you to contact the undersigned if you have any other doubts: Yash Thakker: +91 9725791724 Vidushi Sahay: +91 9871941631 *Regards,* *Student Alumni Relations Cell*
Label: Admin

body: SOCIETY FOR STUDENT MESS SERVICES, PILANI (Registered Under Rajasthan Societies Act, 1958) SSMS Office, Vidya Vihar Campus, BITS Pilani ____________________________________________________________________________________ Greetings, We hope that you enjoyed relishing the healthy and delectable snacks that were served in the Night Canteen for the last 3 days. This is to inform you that post the trial 3-day basis for the Night Canteen, we are happy to announce that the Evening Canteen will be operational on a trial basis for *this week (6th Nov to 12th Nov)* in the same messes. The canteen will serve the same menu and fulfillment of all transactions pertaining to the Evening Canteen shall be at the PitStop via Student ID Cards only. The Pitstop shall also be operational for the sale of usual items during these times. Date: 6th November and 12th November 2021 Time: 4:30 - 5:30 pm Location: Krishna Gandhi and Ram Budh messes Please note that entry into RB and KG messes for Evening Canteen is permitted to all BITSians regardless of their hostel or gender. The menu at both the messes is also made a little different for the sake of variety. Regards SSMS Governing Council

body: Greetings everyone, May this festival add new hope, confidence, and courage to your heart, preparing you for a successful journey forward. Nirmaan volunteers understand the importance of volunteer work and its role in providing better opportunities and equality for everyone. Working online for the last one and half years has taught us a lot but our activities as a NGO have been more impactful working on the campus. To kickstart our momentum for the women empowerment projects this year we bring forth to you Roshani! =E2=80=9CHow far that little candle throws his beams! So shines a good deed= in a weary world.=E2=80=9D =E2=80=95 William Shakespeare, The Merchant of Venice Roshani is our attempt to rekindle our production at full capacity housed at our Swayamshakti Centre at PARC. Assorted diyas with tessellation designs handcrafted by our beneficiaries are in store to light up homes this Diwali. Celebrate the persistent efforts made by people who stayed resilient during the pandemic and are trying their best to rise above their circumstances. Let's help spread light to everyone's home, one diya at a time. Students are requested to come to Akshay and buy the Diyas. We will be selling at the regular Akshay timings till Diwali. If you wish to support the initiative Roshani go ahead and place your Diya orders here: Contacts: Coordinators Srijan: +91 9431711435 Ayush: +91 7776851043 President Rimen: +91 9888732416 Vice President Oishika: +91 8879994931
Label: Admin

body: *Greetings from the Students' Union!* As the diwali vacations are here, there is a rising concern about how one would leave the campus at the most affordable cost for travel. The Student Union of BITS Pilani has commenced the *SU Cab Service,* to provide hassle-free transportation for all the students during the Diwali vacations at the most affordable prices. The cabs can be availed from the campus and return as well from major railway stations and airports of Delhi, Jaipur and Loharu. If you wish to avail the service, reach out to the following contact : *Dhruv Tours and Travels * *Mob - (8769570387 , 9166088888)* Furthermore please fill this google form with all the relevant information regarding you availing the service. *Student Union Cab Service * < Attached are the details regarding how one can avail this service. Failure to comply with the Guidelines can lead to incorrect charges on mess accounts and only the student will be responsible for the same. Upon any queries throughout the process, Contact : *Anirudh TK *- +919840624571 *Yash Saboo *- +919534065076 *Naman Gupta* - +918791629985 *The Students' Union wishes you all a safe journey and a very happy Diwali!* -- *Regards* *Student Union 2021-22*

body: *Greetings from the Students' Union,* It is with a heavy heart that we have to inform you that Shri Mukesh, an employee of the BITS COOP store has passed away on the night of 18th October, 2021. He had been suffering from mouth cancer for the past one year and has left behind a family of which he was the only income source. Shri Ratan Singh, owner of our beloved Gandhi Redi, has also been battling with blood cancer over the past year. We hope that the BITSian community will step forward in their time of need and contribute to reducing their financial burden. Kindly fill the google form given below to donate, the amount would directly be deducted from the SWD account of the student : Form link < Please remember that every single donation counts and will directly impact lives. Let us come together in characteristic BITSian style and support these individuals who have dedicated their lives to this place we all call home. -- *Regards* *Students' Union 2021-22*
Label: Admin

body: Dear Students Please go through the forwarded email. Thanks SM - -------- Forwarded Message -------- Subject: Please Circulate: Research Week with Google 2022 Date: Tue, 19 Oct 2021 11:48:58 +0000 From: rishabhtrivedi@google.com To: sudeeptm@pilani.bits-pilani.ac.in CC: dthakkar@google.com, research-programs-in@google.com Dear Prof. Sudeept Mohan, Hope you are well! I work on University Relations programs at Google Research. We are excited to share notification for a new program for students at your university hosted by Google Research India. Google Research India is hosting a four day *'Research Week with Google'* for Undergraduate, Master's and PhD students in India (combined track for undergraduate and masters students, advanced track for Ph.D students). The program structure is to provide a forum with leading experts to discuss the state-of-art of a variety of ML Techniques and also discuss their limitations and critiques. Research Week with Google will consist of four days of research lectures and discussions where esteemed researchers will discuss ideas and seminal papers in AI Research to understand current developments and debates in the field. This would be a platform to share and learn cutting-edge ideas and developments in the field. We would like to invite applications from final year undergraduate/Master= =E2=80=99s students and PhD students (all years) at your university who are interested in AI from related fields in CS, ECE, EE and other applicable departments. Since we have limited capacity, selection will be competitive. We request you to please circulate this application form < p1HQX41Q4fq-wcvA/viewform> among students.The deadline to apply for the program is 11:59 PM IST, November 15, 2021. For more details visit the program website < Looking forward to seeing several applicants from your institution! Please let Divy (on cc) or I know if you have any questions. Best, Rishabh Trivedi & Divy Thakkar, On behalf of our the organising team and Program chairs (Manish Gupta and Ashwani Sharma) Google Research India ------------------------------ [image: AVG logo] < This email has been checked for viruses by AVG antivirus software. www.avg.com < <#m_-8784117930056942460_DAB4FAD8-2DD7-40BB-A1B8-4E2AA1F9FDF2> --=20 Thanks & regards Dept. of Computer Science & Information Systems BITS-Pilani-333031
Label: Admin

body: Dear All We are pleased to announce the extended library hours during your midterm exam. REVISED LIBRARY TIMINGS *w.e.f 21st October 2021 to 29th October 2021* *MONDAY - SUNDAY* *9:00 AM =E2=80=93 12:00 Midnight* ISSUE/RETURN TIMINGS MONDAY - SUNDAY 9:30 AM =E2=80=93 11:00 PM *Guidelines to be followed in the library* 1. Except laptops, readers are not allowed to carry their personal belongings (bags, brief-cases, parcels etc.). Their personal belongings should be left at the baggage counter located at the entrance and while leaving the library please make sure you pick up your own bag. 2. Always carry your Student ID card when you are visiting the library, failing so will forbid your entry to the library. 3. Always scan your Entry and exit at the Patron Traffic Manager located at the Library entrance. 4. Eatable items are not permitted in the library. 5. The use of mobile phones and other noisy instruments is prohibited= . 6. Library Users should remain silent in the library and not disrupt other users. Members should not engage in loud conversation in any reading area of the library causing disturbance to fellow readers. 7. Sitting on the table and keeping legs on chairs is not permitted. 8. All users are requested to wear a mask in the library and follow the COVID-19 Safety Guidelines. 9. The library has the right to terminate the membership at any time in case of a violation of rules and regulations. On behalf of our library team, I wish you every success. Thanks Librarian

body: Dear Faculty Members, Research Scholars and Students, The Teaching-Learning Centre invites articles for the upcoming issue of the newsletter, Taleem. The focus of the upcoming issue is =E2=80=9CEffective Integration of Teaching and Research=E2=80=9D. Please find below a brief description of the topic: Maintaining a healthy balance between teaching and research has been a topic of much discussion. With research publication acquiring more importance in recent times, there has been a major concern that the quality of teaching might be compromised. While the undergraduate students may not be interested in the latest research in the field, teachers are expected to maintain an active research profile. The tendency to think of research and teaching as mutually exclusive aggravates the situation. In the light of these, the next issue of Taleem aims to initiate a discussion on how teachers can think of ways in which teaching and research can be integrated effectively, thereby evolving a model where teaching and research will be complimentary. The Teaching Learning Centre invites articles from faculty members, research scholars, students, and administrators on the above-mentioned topic. We request you to send us your valuable contributions on any aspect of the questions of =E2=80=9CEffective Integration of Teaching and Research= =E2=80=9D with an approximate limit of four hundred words. You can also contribute to cartoons, memes, etc. The deadline for submission is 15 November 2021. Kindly send your articles to taleem.tlc.bits@gmail.com Regards, Editorial team of Taleem
Label: Admin

Important instructions regarding course withdrawal are as follows: =C2=A7 Once a course is withdrawn, it is an irreversible action. =C2=A7 While applying for withdrawal of course(s), please ensure that your graduation requirements (in terms of number of units and number of courses) are not affected. Due to the withdrawal of course(s), any delay in graduation will be an individual student=E2=80=99s responsibility. =C2=A7 Final decision regarding course withdrawal request will be taken by= FIC, Registration & Counseling. Students must confirm the final status of course withdrawal on ERP portal by *November 13*, 2021. =C2=A7 In case of any issue related to login credentials write to *erp.support@hyderabad.bits-pilani.ac.in * *In case of any issue related to withdrawal*, send an email with the subject line* =E2=80=9CIssue related to withdrawal=E2=80=9D to * abhisek.dadhich@pilani.bits-pilani.ac.in *latest by November 10, 2021. *Aft= er this date, no discrepancy case will be entertained. body: Greetings from Pilani Innovation & Entrepreneurship Development Society (PIEDS), BITS Pilani TBI. PIEDS Society has supported startups such as Goodera, pepper content, Elixa= r systems (Kalam Labs), and many more. PIEDS has opened up the call for startups where startups would receive *funding, **business training, expert support, coaching, and mentoring to help you **accelerate the journey of your startup. **APPLY NOW * < 70f> *Who is it for?* 1. You have a start-up idea that you would like to Validate and Develop. 2. You have a definite proof-of-concept (PoC) and you are now looking out for support in developing a Minimum Viable Product (MVP) 3. You are looking out for support in Market Outreach, Commercial launch, Product Development *Which sectors/technologies/domains are we keen on?* You should consider applying to the incubator if you are focusing your efforts on leveraging emerging technologies such as the Internet of things (IoT), Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, Robotics, data science, AR/VR towards solving problems in any of the following themes/areas: Healthcare, Education, Fintech, SaaS-based startups, Cryptocurrency *How does the program look like?* PIEDS Start-up Incubation program is offered in two flavors to cater to start-ups in different stages of their lifecycle - concept stage startups qualify for pre-incubation (5-6 months); start-ups whose ideas have evolved, are working on an MVP, aiming to scale, are eligible for incubation(18 months) and would be provided funding up to 7 lakhs under TIDE 2.0 scheme of MEIITY, Govt of India. *What do you get from being part of the program?* - Mentoring from Experts of your startup domain - Initial seed funding up to 7 lakhs and investor connects from top VC firms. - Access to the Incubation space and labs/facilities - Technology credits from Amazon Web Services, Freshworks, Digital Ocean, Zoho, Hubspot, Google cloud, Mathworks - Business Services: Vakil Search, Harda & Co, Startup Movers, Mohit Vijay and Associates, Resurgent India, letsventure, ShellE4, HDFC Smartu= p - Resources and networks from other partners such as CIIE-IIMA, IIM Udaipur Incubation, IIM C Innovation Park, ISB=E2=80=93AIC, Banasthali= =E2=80=93AIC, i-start, Villgro, TiE Rajasthan, T-hub, and many more. *Application Process: Deadline Extended to 20th October 2021* Application Link: *APPLY NOW * < 70f>

body: Dear Student, Please find the revised list of allotments. We understand that many of you are not getting a room as per your expectations. Remember one thing, once you are on campus and meeting your friends, I am sure that you will forget all the grievances you are having. In this phase, we have called the students based on the availability of locked rooms. The data is very dynamic due to many reasons. Please find your allotment of the room from the Here are general answers to the queries you have posted. *Common Queries:* *1. Want a single room but have been allotted a double room?* *We are aware of the fact that some of the rooms have been left unoccupied. This is due to inadequate data because of the fast and dynamic process in the current scenario.The empty/locked rooms will be allocated once things settle down. Please be patient until then. All the unoccupied rooms can be allotted on request from 17th October onwards. If you and some of your friends agree to mutual shifting, we will sort out the issue after your arrival.* *2. Allotted rooms are occupied by PS or off-campus TS students?* You may stay with your friend or get a room with the help of the respective hostel superintendent for the time being. After 17th October, if required depending on the vacancy, we will try to re-allocate you. We expect your cooperation in the process and hope that you understand the situation right now. Please be rest assured that we are with you in the whole room allotment process and trying to do our best. With best regards, *Navin Singh <

body: Dear Students : Proposals for funding are invited from first-degree students to carry out important projects during the academic year 2021-22. The selected projects will be given financial support by the Institute on the basis of merit of the project, deliverable(s), and budget availability. *Objective*: The objective of the funding is to support first-degree students to carry out important and innovative projects in an academic year. *Eligible Applicants:* First-degree students of BITS Pilani (2nd Year onward) are eligible to submit the proposal. Projects exceeding 6 participants are not open for consideration under this category of funding. *Expenses:* Equipment costs, conference fees, materials for construction, and manufacturing services may be considered for funding. *Funding Amount:* The amount of Institute funding for a team cannot exceed Rs. 50000/- in an academic year. Over and above, funding may be considered on the basis of deliverable(s), the merit of the projects and budget availability. However, team(s) can explore possible sources of additional funding from other sources if required. *Faculty Supervisor:* Students are advised to take guidance from faculty members who agree to be a mentor for the proposed project. *Deadlines* *Activity* October 13, 2021 Applications to be advertised October 20, 2021 Last date of submission of Applications October 23, 2021 Decisions made regarding allocations of funds October 26, 2021 Notifications to applicants March 10, 2022 Invoices of the financial year 2021-2 to be processed on/or before March 10, 2022 for reimbursement. Invoices after April 01, 2022 can be submitted till the closing day of the project (i.e. May 15, 2022). *Submission:* Interested first-degree students are required to submit the hard copy of the complete proposal in the prescribed format to the office (Room No. 2112). A soft copy of the form is attached herewith. *Applicants also need to register online through a google form available at: < *Project Evaluation:* A campus-level committee appointed by the Campus Director will evaluate the submitted projects. Based on the recommendation of the committee, only selected projects would be supported for funding. Thanks and regards *Associate Dean, AUGSD*

body: Greetings from IPCD! We are pleased to announce that BITS Pilani has partnered with EPF, France for a *Semester Exchange Program*. EPF < was established in 1925 and is one of the premier engineering institutions in France. It was established as one of the first French institutes that taught science and engineering to women. For all students currently in their *pre-final year* pursuing *Mechanical Engineering, Civil Engineering, or Computer Science Engineering*, who wish to do an exchange semester during the next fall semester (*September-December 2022*), are requested to apply for the same using the google form link down below. Candidates must upload their updated Resumes and cover letters and fill in all the required fields for application. The candidates applying must have completed their CDCs and the applications of those who will be in their final year in the academic year of 2022 will be given a preference. Due to requests from multiple students, the deadline for applying through the google form is extended to *11:59 PM IST, 15th October 2021 (Friday).* *Link for Form: *EPF France: Semester Exchange Program Application < For any further doubts, please contact: Kirat: f20190735@pilani.bits-pilani.ac.in Karman: f20201896@pilani.bits-pilani.ac.in Hrishit: f20200346@pilani.bits-pilani.ac.in Regards*,* Team IPCD

body: Dear Student, You are allowed to *leave for home* after the mid-sem (only). The procedure for the same is as follows: - The leave should be applied *through a portal only*. Any email/phone call for the leave won't be entertained. - The respective hostel warden will approve the leave through the portal. Only after the approval you will be permitted to leave. - The leave should be applied (through the portal) at least *24 hours* before leaving the campus. - Only in case of any *unavoidable circumstances*, the time limit will be relaxed. - No phone calls for unnecessary requests will be entertained. - Upon return from the break, a student has to produce the negative report of the RT-PCR done from an ICMR approved lab [ valid for 72 hours] (even if they are fully vaccinated). - Parents *won't be allowed* inside campus when the students return from their post-mid-sem break. - Remember, you can avail the *leave once* in the current semester. *P.S.: You will be receiving a notification about the portal very soon.* *No queries in this regard will be entertained. We will cancel the leave request in case of receiving any email in this regard!* With best wishes, *Navin Singh* < <
Label: Admin

body: *BIRLA INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY & SCIENCE, PILANI (RAJ.)* *STUDENT WELFARE DIVISION* *Date-05/10/2021* *NOTICE* *OUTDOOR SPORTS* The Outdoor sports facilities are meant for* bonafide students of BITS and Staff members only.* Please note the timings to use the sports facilities w.e.f. *06.10.2021*. - Morning- 06:00 - 08.00 AM - Evening- 05:00 - 08:00 PM *POINT TO NOTE:* - Come in a proper sports kit to ensure safety and discipline. - *Children below 15 years and people wearing sleepers are not allowed in the sports ground.* - Carry your Institute ID card while using sports facilities. Sports items will be issued only to staff and students of BITS. - Sports staffs are not responsible for loss of any personal belongings. - Gym Ground is open for sports activities only, sitting in the ground is not allowed. - Prior permission (On first come first serve basis) is to be obtained to use the cricket ground beyond working hours. For Cricket ground booking mark your entry in the register kept on the Gym Ground issue counter. - Entry for Gym Ground is allowed only through the main gate. Necessary action will be taken if somebody is found jumping over the wall. Thank you all for your support. Student Welfare Division

He will be available to all students for any kind of counseling be it personal (any area) or academic. Interested students are encouraged to contact Mr. Scott for prior appointment. Please note that counseling/consultation is always done on a one-to-one and confidential basis and is *completely free* of charge for the student. *Please note that last minute drop out, after taking an appointment is not encouraged. In such cases, you might not get a subsequent appointment in future.* Cancellation, under exceptional circumstances, should be notified in advance so that others can be accommodated. Prior appointments can be obtained only through your BITS Email ID. body: *BIRLA INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY & SCIENCE, PILANI* *STUDENT WELFARE DIVISION* No. SWD/SCH/73 Dated: July 18, 2019 *NOTICE* *Institute Merit-Cum-Need Scholarships, First Semester, 2019-2020* *All first degree students should note the following procedure for applying for the Institute Merit-cum-Need Scholarships for First Semester 2019-2020* *.* 1. The award of scholarships will be decided at the end of First Semester and will be based on the performance of students in the First Semester. 2. The types of scholarships are as follows: i.) Merit Scholarships: These will cover 100% reimbursement of semester fees for 1% students and 40% of semester fees for 2% students. ii.) Merit-cum-Need Scholarships: These will cover 80% reimbursement of semester fees for 3% students; 40% of semester fees for 6% students; 25% of semester fees for 12% students and 15% of semester fees for 6% students. 3. There is no waiver of admission fee. 4. No application is necessary for Merit Scholarships. 5. The application should be submitted on-line on or before 5.00 p.m. Thursday, 26th September 2019, through SWD website link ( This will be accessible from 1= 0 th August 2019. 6. Latest income certificate(s) should be submitted before the deadline along with the details of the applicant on a cover sheet available at SWD office (Room No. 2101). *DOCUMENTS TO BE SUBMITTED* The following documents for the *FINANCIAL YEAR 2018-19 (ASSESSMENT YEAR 2019-20)* should be submitted:- *If parents/guardians are*: *Salaried/Engaged in Business/Pensioner* =E2=80=93 a) If parent(s)/guardian are *salaried persons/Business*, Copy of *I= TR V along with Computation of income* stamped by IT department clearly showing the gross income can be submitted (copy of E-Filing of returns is also valid). b) If Engaged in *Agriculture only* =E2=80=93 Original Income Certific= ate from *Mandal Revenue* *Officer* gross income for the *financial year* *2018-2019* (*ASSESSMENT YEAR 2019-20)* based on the income of the preceding financial year along with parents bank statement for past six months. In case of any educational loan, a copy of loan sanction letter to be submitted. c) *Pensioners *shall submit the Retirement letter along with the bank statement showing the pension credited. In case of any educational loan, a copy of loan sanction letter to be submitted. *NOTE* *1) **AFFIDAVITS* are directly rejected. *2) **Mere income statements* and *declarations* by parents/their employers, notary affidavit, certificate from bank, annual pension statements etc will not be accepted. *3) *Income certificates of *BOTH *parents must be provided in case both are earning persons. *4) *All the income statements should be for the *Financial Year 2018-19 (Assessment Year* *2019-20) dated after 1st April 2019.* *5) *Income statements of *earlier years* will be *directly rejected*. *THE ELIGIBILTY CRITERIA FOR AWARD OF SCHOLARSHIP* *a) *The scholarships are awarded to students based on *CGPA* and gross annual income of parent(s)/guardian from all sources should be less than the maximum prescribed by the Scholarships Committee. Prescribed maximum limit for the previous semester was Rs. 10,00,000/- p.a. *b) *No NC/E report in the first semester. *c) *No case of indiscipline in the semester for which scholarship is applied. *d) *Not availing any external scholarship that carries a condition that the student is not receiving any other scholarship. Students are to certify that they are not availing any other scholarship such as Inspire/KVPY etc. Any student availing fee benefit scheme is not eligible. *e) *In case of any ambiguity, certificates in original should be produced by the student on demand. *f) *Any discrepancies in the Parents details provided when compared with the previous semester the application will be directly rejected without any intimation. *g) *Both the Parents/guardians gross total income should be clearly mentioned. *h) *The application for MCN should be filled in very clearly and no changes will be encouraged later. *i) *All the applications, documents and certificates will be scrutinized by the authorities. It is the responsibility of all the students to *check notices and SWD Portal or contact the SWD* *office* for details of the MCN Scholarship. All decisions of the *Scholarships Committee* are final and binding. * (Prof. Srikanta Routroy)* * Associate Dean *

body: Greetings from NSS BITS PILANI, This is a reminder mail for the BOSM Marathon which is to be held at 5:30 pm, today. To move a step closer to our dream of a healthy BITS campus, Project Umang in collaboration with FitBITS and Sports Council presents a run, a prequel to the UMANG COLLECTION 2K19. This *3km/6.5km run* is to be held on the *26th of August (Today) at 5:30 pm* wherein the students and faculty members would all come together to *Run for a Cause.* We are extremely privileged to be born into good families who can support all our education and our other basic needs but not everyone is as lucky as we are. Umang Collection is a nationally recognized 4 day campus fundraiser in which we urge all the BITSians to donate so that we can support the education of the economically backward section of the society living in and around the area of Pilani. Every person who donates is a hero for these underprivileged students because they actually do change someone=E2=80=99s life and we must not forget that *NOT ALL SUPERHEROES WEA= R CAPES.* This run is for everyone ranging from a beginner to a professional runner and the run would be followed by e-certificates registered for all the participating runners. With a number of props and photo booths set up, we promise to make the run an enjoyable and memorable experience for you. All the recipients are cordially invited to join us to promote the cause of education for all the people living in and around the areas of Pilani. Contacts: Pawan Sikawat: +91-8003522534 Abhay Kanodia: +91-7355924231 *DATE: 26th August 2019.* *DAY: Monday* *TIME: 5:30pm* *VENUE: Clock Tower*

body: Maharashtra Mandal, BITS, Pilani Presents Competitions for Children in *Ganeshotsav* 2019 (*2nd - 4th September 2019*) This is to inform all the faculty members that as a part of *Ganeshotsav* celebration, Maharashtra Mandal will be organizing a *Fancy Dress* and *Impromptu Speech* Competition on 2nd September 2019 (Monday) in the evening 8:30 PM onwards. The age group for the same will be as follows: *Fancy Dress:* Group I: 3 years to 6 years Group II: 7 years to 10 years *Impromptu Speech:* Only One Group: 11-15 years of age *Fancy Dress Competition*: Parents are requested to register their wards by sending Name and Class of the kids on Whatsapp Number 8118850291, on, or before 4 PM on Sunday, September 1, 2019. You will be provided with a serial number upon registration. Entries will be taken on first come first basis. First 30 entries will be entertained. If you wish to play some specific music while your child is performing, kindly bring it along in a pen drive, half an hour before the program (at 8:30 pm on 2nd September 2019). *For Impromptu Speech Competition*: Participants will be allowed to choose one of the contemporary topics from the bowl via Lottery System. They will be given 1.5-2 minutes to think, organize and precisely 1 (one) minute to speak. Delivery of content will be allowed only in Hindi or English language. Winners will be decided based on delivery of the organized thought content. Parents can send entries by sending a Whatsapp message on number 8118850291, on, or before 12 PM on Sunday, September 1, 2019. A limited number of 20 entries will be entertained, on first come, first served basis. Maharashtra Mandal, BITS, Pilani Meghana Tare, PhD Assistant Professor 3277-J, Department of Biological Sciences Birla Institute of Technology & Science, Pilani Vidya Vihar Pilani 333031, Rajasthan, India +91-1596-515635

body: *Hello Freshers,* I hope you all are enjoying your new college life and doing well in academics. Some of you may be aware of the *MERIT Cum Need & Merit Scholarships*. Since the deadline of MCN is coming nearby, it is advisable to fill the form and submit the required documents as soon as possible. You don=E2=80= =99t have to do anything for Merit Scholarship. *Procedure for MCN-* *(i) *The application should be submitted online along with parental income proof in the SWD office on or before 5.00 p.m. Wednesday, *= 26th September 2019*, through the application form available at the SWD internet website ( *(ii) * Income certificate(s) of parent(s)/guardian must be submitted before the deadline, along with the details of the applicant on the cover sheet available at* the SWD office (21**01)*. The certificate should indicate the gross income. Income certificates of both parents, if both are employed, should be submitted along with a photocopy of PAN cards. body: BITS Pilani is committed to maintaining a working and learning environment free of intimidation, fear, bullying, revenge, retaliation in which students, faculty, and staff can develop intellectually, professionally, personally, and socially. Sexual harassment by University employees, faculty, staff, and students is illegal conduct and will not be tolerated in BITS Pilani. The Supreme Court has defined 'sexual harassment' to include o Physical contact and advances o Demand or request for sexual favors o Sexually colored remarks o Display of pornography o Any other unwelcome physical, verbal or non-verbal conduct of a sexual nature directly or by implication. The Internal Complaints Committee (ICC) of BITS PIlani, Pilani campus with following members works with an aim to provide for the effective enforcement of the basic human right of gender equality and guarantee against sexual harassment and abuse. *Name* *Affiliation* *Phone No.* *E-mail id* *Prof. Surekha Bhanot* * Presiding officer* *EEE Deptt* *9694096461* *surekha@pilani.bits-pilani.ac.in * * Dr. Meghana Tare, * *Faculty Member * * Biological Sciences Deptt* *8118850291* * meghana.tare@pilani.bits-pilani.ac.in * * Dr. Shibani Jha,* * Faculty Member* *Civil Engg Dept.* *9845936105* *shibani@pilani.bits-pilani.ac.in * *Ms** Neelam Bhatia,* *Non-Teaching Staff Member* *Admissions office* *9950676006* *neelam.bits@pilani.bits-pilani.ac.in * *Mr. N Sreekanth Reddy , **Non-Teaching Staff Member* *Head, HR* *9010821821* *Sreekanthreddy.n@hyderabad.bits-pilani.ac.in * *Dr. M. Kasturi, Member* *Principal, Birla Balika Vidyapeeth* *01596-242124(o)/* *242548(r)* *principalbbv@gmail.com * *Ms Vidushi Asati* *Student Member (Research Scholar)* *9649176847* *vidushi.asati@pilani.bits-pilani.ac.in * *Ms Sakshi Gupta* *Student Member* *(First Degree) * *77269963333* *f20171107@pilani.bits-pilani.ac.in * *Mr. G Adityan* *Student Member* *(First Degree)* *7597636328* *f20160929@pilani.bits-pilani.ac.in * *Where, whom and how to lodge a complaint?* If you are a victim of sexual harassment or perceive yourself to be, immediately contact (personally or through telephone / written request / e-mail) any of the committee members of the ICC. *Complaints can be made by the person facing harassment or even by a third party.* ICC shall ensure that the complaint is kept totally confidential, and adequate protection is provided to the complainant, where necessary. Complaints shall be heard expeditiously while adhering to the principle of Natural Justice. Necessary recommendations will be made to the competent authority on the basis of the findings of the inquiry. The ICC shall comply with the procedure prescribed in the UGC (Prevention, Prohibition and Redressal of Sexual Harassment of Women Employees and Students in Higher Educational Institutions) Regulations, 2015 in dealing with the complaint *Prof. Surekha Bhanot*
Label: Admin

body: Dear All, In view of the expected rise in the number of cases of Dengue during the coming days, the following steps may help. Try to avoid sitting/standing outdoors early mornings and evenings before dark. Wear full sleeves shirts,pants and socks if you need to come out of rooms at these times.Mosquito repellent creams may also be applied instead.(The mosquito prefers biting at legs and feet). Use mosquito repellant like 'All Out','Good Night',etc inside the rooms.Please keep one window open while using these so that the fumes don't get collected inside. Dengue fever causes fever as high as 102 to 103 degree F with severe headache,backache and nausea.There is no associated cough,runny nose or sore throat.If any one has these symptoms he/she should take Paracetamol 650 mg (for those weighing more than 50kg) and inform the Hostel Superintendent to seek medical help.(Each Superintendent keeps Paracetamol tablet in his/her First aid kit). Warm regards, Dr Rajiv Gupta CMO.
Label: Admin

body: *Exciting opportunity for all Startups. * [image: unnamed.png] Greetings, Startup Jalsa a startup platform - on a mission to inspire and invest in entrepreneurial talent - and helping founders build enduring businesses. Since our inception as a conference in 2015, over 2000 companies have participated in the various events of Startup Jalsa and they have gone on to raise cumulatively over 500crores in funding. Notable participating companies like , Mobiquest - A PayTM group company, The Viral Fever, UpGrad, The Beer Cafe, , Jugnoo, Sattviko, HealthifyMe, and Pumpkart are now the market leaders in their specific sectors. We also have a strategic partnership with Indo European Business Forum, UK which counts Mr. GP Hinduja, Co-Chairman of Hinduja Group, Mr. Kishore Lulla, Chairman, Eros International as its members - which gives our portfolio companies unprecedented access to both traditional businesses and the startup ecosystem. This year, in our 5th edition, we are going across borders by organizing Pitch Sessions across South Asia - India, Nepal, Sri-Lanka and Bangladesh. [image: startup2019.png] *Tentative speakers:* - Mr. Arvind R Vohra, Founder & Executive Director Gionee India - Mr. Vineet Narang, Co-Founder & CEO Mobiquest Technologies - Mr. Sattvik Mishra, Co-Founder & CEO - Mr. Shailesh Vikram Singh, Partner Massive Fund, ex-Seedfund.in - Mr. Sumit Jain, Co-Founder CommonFloor & CEO Click here to Register Yourself < *Use the discount coupon to avail a 10% discount on the registration fee: JALSA01* To Know More, Click Here <

body: Greetings BITSians, Are you stuck on an innovative idea but don=E2=80=99t know what to make of = it? Do you have a superb project idea but in dire need of funding? Do you want to make a mark and stand out in your batch? Or are you simply looking for some opportunity to add some goodies to your CV? Don=E2=80=99t worry, we got you covered. *Mechanical Engineering Associatio= n *presents *BITS Innovation Challenge* on the auspicious occasion of *Engineer=E2=80= =99s Day, *i.e. 15th September on theme of *Smart India (Engineering for Change)*. This competition is group based and is *open for students from all disciplines and every year of study, both Single Degree as well as Higher Degree programs*. Students may form groups of up to 5 students each, preferably of different disciplines. Think of an innovative idea that can be inculcated in a smart city project or BITS Campus Few topics you can refer to, but not limited to, are: 1) Smart Building 2) Smart Grid 3) IOT 4) Rainwater Harvesting 5) Air Conditioning Winning teams have a chance to get: 1) Prices worth up to *=E2=82=B910,000* 2) Mentoring by various professors specializing in concerned fields of study before your final presentation. 3) Good Projects will be encouraged with further guidance from experienced faculty (Study Oriented Project) with probable funding. 4) Top 3 teams would be awarded certificates. All interested students are thereby requested to fill in this google form < MA/prefill> latest by *12th September, 11:59pm*. The competition would consist of 3 Rounds. *Round-1 *of the competition will be held on *15th September*. In this round, each team would be required to submit a 1-slide PowerPoint presentation summarising their idea (problem statement). *Link for the Round 1 submission: * Mhrt2EcBdLEhZDg/viewform?usp=3Dpp_url *Deadline for Round 1 submission is 14th September, 1800 hrs.* Details of other rounds will be conveyed to the students clearing Round-1 on 15th September. The winning team of Round-3 would be getting prices worth upto *=E2=82=B910,000* *DISCLAMER* : Please Ignore previous mail For any further queries, kindly contact the undersigned. Shikhar Latoria : 9131382479 Gaurav Rathi : 9649999397 Jai Rawal : 8739975529

body: Dear Faculty Colleagues, staff members and Students, You will be happy to know that in view of the suggestions received from students and faculty members from time to time, BITS Pilani, Pilani Campus has decided to establish a centre of Mpower on the first floor of Medical Centre, Vidya Vihar. The Center will extend professional support and empower students, faculty, staff and their families to overcome their mental health related concerns. Mrs Neerja Birla (Founder of Mpower and the wife of our Chancellor Dr. Kumarmangalam Birla) has kindly consented to grace the occasion to inaugurate the center at 5.00 PM on 27 September 2019 in the auditorium . Ms Ananya Birla a renowned singer, song writer, an entrepreneur and Co-founder of Mpower will perform during the inauguration. We seek your all out support to make the inauguration function a grand success. regards -- ashoke Sarkar Ashoke K. Sarkar, Ph.D Director

body: *BIRLA INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY AND SCIENCE, PILANI, PILANI CAMPUS* *AUGS / AGSR DIVISION* 09/09/2019 *NOTICE FOR UNFAIR MEANS CASES* Although our students maintain high ethical values in academic matters, sometimes a few of them get tempted and attempt the use of unfair means in examinations. In order to maintain discipline and high ethical values, the Institute is forced to take strict actions in such cases. The guideline for the punishment to unfair means cases is as follows: *Code* *Offence* *Punishment* 1.0 Possession of any communication device such as a mobile phone in the examination hall; possession of any written material generally not allowed during examinations. Warning 2.0 Possession of material, in any form, relevant to the subject but not caught in the act of copying. Registration cancelled for the said course 3.0 Simple cases of copying during the examinations / Simple cases of tampering with the answer book either during the examination or during the distribution of answer scripts Registration cancelled for the said course 4.0 Severe cases of copying during the examination / Severe cases of tampering with the answer book either during the examination or during the distribution of answer scripts Registration cancelled for the said course and debarred to register for one semester to two years, including summer terms, depending on the degree of severity of the offence. 5.0 Impersonation (deputing a person on one=E2=80=99s behalf to write the exami= nation or appearing for a person to write the examination) Registration cancelled for the said course and discontinued from the programme *All the students are advised to maintain a high ethical standard and should not attempt to use unfair means in academic matters and during examinations. *Details of the actions taken report for the last one year is given below for the information of all concerned. *Sl. No.* *Unfair means Offence* *Number of cases* *Decision Made* 1 Simple Cases of Copying/tempering during the examinations 11 Registration is cancelled in the concerned course (Code 2.0 & 3.0). 2 Severe Cases of Copying during the examinations / tampering of any kind with the answer book either during the examination or during the distribution of answer scripts 11 Registration is cancelled in the concerned course and debarred form registration for one semester (Code 4.0). Associate Deans
Label: Admin

body: Dear Student, Please find the guidelines to apply for the outstation leave. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- *You should follow the following steps to apply for the leave*: Please download the mobile app "*SWD leave management system*" through the *Google play store* and install to your smartphone. You can use the *IP 172.22.6.2* to login to SWD leave management portal. This facility is provided by "SBNA Technology". 1. Login first through your username which is your ID (For example 2017A1PS0000 or 2017B1A10000. For higher degree students 2017H0000000). Your password (first time) will be twice of your ID. Please change your password after the first login. If you still could not login in, please get it to reset from SWD. 2. After login click + button on the screen and apply for your leave after filling all fields. 3. Once your *warden approves* leave an *SMS will go to your parent mobile* number which is registered with us. You can also check whether your leave is approved or not. 4. Please apply for your outstation leave *at least 24 hrs* in advance. Your warden will approve leave once a day. Contact your warden regarding this. 5. At the time of leaving campus, *put your thumb at the proper biometric machine* (a security person at the gate will assist you) installed at the gate and proceed for the leave. At that point of time, your parent will get another SMS. 6. After your leave completion put your thumb again in the bio-metric machine which will confirm your entry in campus and will inform the parent (BY SMS) that you have reached the campus. *Note:* *If your thumb impression is not registered with SWD, then the security personal will not allow you to leave campus. If you face any issue with leave application contact SWD*. *POINT TO NOTE* 1. If you are going out of the campus *after 8:00 PM,* you must take prior permission by filling out and submitting the Outstation Form Online. 2. The online outstation form must be filled and submitted before 24 hours of your departure; for example: if you have to leave the campus at 10 AM tomorrow then the outstation form must be submitted by 10:00 AM today or earlier. 3. The reason for going out must be clearly stated; otherwise, your application is liable to be rejected. 4. The online outstation form can be filled in the following TWO ways: - *via the mobile app* as follows: - Download the mobile app "*SWD leave management system*" through the Google Play store and install to your smartphone. You can use the IP *172.22.6.2* to login to SWD leave management portal. This facility is provided by "SBNA Technology". - Login first through your username which is your ID (For example *2017A1PS0000* or 2017B1A10000. For higher degree students *2017H0000000*). - Your password (first time) will be twice of your ID. Please change your password after the first login. If you still cannot login in, please get it to reset from SWD. - *via PC app* (i.e. the app can be downloaded on your PC using the same IP: It will show SBNA technologies logo) NOTE: the *PC app works* equally well. It often works *better than the mobile app.* - If you are facing problems in accessing your online leave management portal, please contact SWD office immediately to get it fixed. - Excuses for not following the above instructions will not be accepted. *NOTE:* If you call up any of the wardens from the BITS the main gate for granting permission to leave, you will be denied permission to leave. With best regards, *Navin Singh* < (Chief Warden)
Label: Admin

body: Dear Students, The Institute=E2=80=99s Academic Regulations allow transfer of bright and h= ighly motivated students to the Higher Degree / Ph.D. Programme. Students, *graduating in December, 2021* and interested in admission to the Higher Degree/ Ph.D. programme may do so by seeking a transfer to the same. A graduating Student of a particular campus can seek for a transfer to a higher degree programme offered at that campus. A Student can also seek a transfer to a Higher Degree/Ph.D. program offered at the other campus if that particular programme is not offered in his/her campus. body: Greetings from the Alumni Relation Cell! It is with great pleasure that we bring to you "Know your Distinguished Alumnus", a series of talks with some of the most celebrated Alumni of our institute. The series will include all the alumni who have been awarded the DAA awards for 2021 and include some of the most well-known alumni in the fields of Academia, Research, Entrepreneurship, Public Life, Philanthropy, and Corporate Leadership. For the first event of the series, we have with us Mr. Ranjan Mohapatra (BITS Pilani '84). He obtained his B.E. (Hons.) in Mechanical Engineering from BITS Pilani, Pilani Campus in the year 1984. He subsequently obtained his Post Graduate Diploma in Management (1992) from Xavier Institute of Management, Bhubaneswar. He is currently serving as the Director (Human Resources) on the Board of Indian Oil Corporation since February 2018. He is also serving as the Chairman of Lanka IOC, and also the Chairman of Indian Oil (Mauritius) Ltd., overseas subsidiaries of Indian Oil in Sri Lanka and Mauritius, respectively. [image: Know Your Alumni_FF (1).jpg] Details of the event: Date: 10th November 2021 Time: 4 PM Register here: lu.ma/daa-rajan-mohapatra The event will be held on the Zoom platform. ------------------------------------- Thank you -- *Geetika* *Content Writer- Alumni Relations Unit* =E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2= =96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96= =84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84= =E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2= =96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96= =84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84= =E2=96=84

body: It has been observed recently that a *group of students* has indulged in the circulation of certain objectionable information through mail among the GBM regarding the* sale of BITSian merchandise*. It is reiterated that it violates the existing Student Union guidelines and the laws established by the Institution. The *payment method* associated with the mail mentioned above is impermissible and inadmissible to the institute. We have also identified certain illicit secondary activities going on with the case. The whole offer consequently stands void. *It is hence advised to buy merchandise validated and approved by the Student Union ONLY.* The institution and Student Union equivocally condemn unauthorized action. *The students are advised not to indulge in such illegitimate malpractices, and any involvement will attract firm action.* *Regards* *Student Union 2019-20*

body: Dear Professors and BITSian=E2=80=99s, Greetings!!! We are in the middle of a pandemic that has forced the teaching-learning process to redefine itself in many ways. A remarkable effort has been put by both the teaching fraternity and the students of BITS to create a semblance of the =E2=80=9Cregular=E2=80=9D teaching-learning process in the= se turbulent times. While all of us are eagerly waiting for the reopening of the on-campus classes, the Students' Academic Cell < and the Teaching Learning Centre < want to solicit your feedback on the online mode of education that the institute has adopted this semester. This data will be very helpful to gauge the effectiveness from point of view of both the stakeholders involved in the teaching-learning process. We will greatly appreciate if you will fill the google form survey which will not more than 10 minutes of your time. Student=E2=80=99s Survey Link: < Professor=E2=80=99s Survey Link: Please note that all entries will be anonymous, and the results of the survey will be shared in an the event presided over by the institute dignitaries. Next up, TLC and SAC are jointly planning to have an open online meet with = all the students and the faculty community to present the survey results and discuss the proceeding of the online semester- the success, scope of improvement, and preferably suggestions. Let us all keep working towards achieving the common goal i.e., online academic excellence @ BITS Pilani. For the success of this exercise, we urge each one of you to participate in this survey. The last date for filling the survey is November 15th, 2020. Best Wishes, Student Academic Council Teaching Learning Center Dr. Pushp Lata Associate Professor of English and Communication Department of Humanities and Social Sciences Faculty Incharge Teaching Learning Centre BITS, Pilani
Label: Admin

body: Dear Faculty Members, Research Scholars, and Students, The Teaching-Learning Centre invites articles for the upcoming issue of the newsletter, *Taleem*. The focus of the upcoming issue is =E2=80=9COnline Learning=E2=80=9D. You can also contribute to cartoons, memes, etc. *The extended deadline for submission is 20 November 2020.* Kindly send your articles to taleem.tlc.bits@gmail.com You can read the previous issues of *Taleem *by clicking on the following link: Regards, Editorial team of *Taleem* Dr. Pushp Lata Associate Professor of English and Communication Department of Humanities and Social Sciences Faculty Incharge Teaching Learning Centre BITS, Pilani

body: *BIRLA INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY & SCIENCE, PILANI CAMPUS* *REGISTRATION & COUNSELING* *FIRST SEMESTER 2021-22* Date: 28.08.2021 *ADDITION / SUBSTITUTION* =C3=98 The online process for addition/ substitution for *First Degree and Higher Degree students* is scheduled during *August 29, 2021 (starting from 10 AM) to September 01, 2021 (up to 11:59 PM). * =C3=98 The list of seats available for addition/ substitution in various Elective courses is *available on AUGS-AGSR Division website (* * < ). The exact number of seats may vary depending on the requirement. You can apply for other course(s) also which are not mentioned in the list, however, registration will only be allowed in case of availability of seats vacating due to substituting out by other students in that course(s). *Procedure for Addition/Substitution of course* =C2=B7 Addition and Substitution requests will be submitted through *AUGS-AGSR Division website* =C2=B7 The criteria for the addition/ substitution of course(s) w= ill be as follows: o As per the semester wise pattern for First Degree students of various disciplines, requests for the Humanities elective courses will be processed in the order starting from second year to final year based on the priority number (*reverse order*) of a student. o Requests for the discipline and open elective courses (other than Humanities) will be processed in the order starting from final year to second year based on the priority number (*reverse order*) of a student. For a particular course, first preference will be given to the student of the same discipline followed by minor students (if any) and then others. o Students should ensure that the requested course for addition/ substitution fits in their existing Time Table without any clash. Addition/ substitution request will automatically stand cancel if it creates clash in Time Table. =C2=B7 *Compulsory (Core) courses are not allowed for substitution.* =C2=B7 It is the individual student=E2=80=99s responsibility to ensu= re the eligibility for the course as well as graduation requirements (in terms of number of units and number of courses). =C2=B7 *Check your final course package for the semester after compl= etion of addition/ substitution exercise by 5 PM on September 4, 2021.* best wishes *Faculty In-charge, Registration & Counselling* Birla Institute of Technology & Science (BITS), Pilani Pilani Campus, Vidya Vihar Pilani - 333031, Rajasthan, India

body: Dear All, We are happy to announce the launch of BITS notice board portal ( The portal will facilitate the posting of general notices to all the user community and to specific targeted groups. Currently all the notices are sent through e-mail. The present system supports mainly three groups namely student, Faculty and staff. The mails can be sent to individual groups or to multiple groups. The present facility does not offer mail delivery to the fine grained targeted email groups causing the individual mailbox cluttering. The team of IPC and SDET has taken up a new initiative and they have created a portal which aims to provide a single dashboard for the posting and access to the various notices/announcements. To begin with , we intend to provide notice posting rights to Head of departments, division heads, faculty-in-charges and unit heads. Once the facility is operationalized, the root email facility will be withdrawn. The individual faculty members will continue to use the Nalanda email/announcement facility to send the course related communication to the students. Hoping for your kind cooperation. With the best regards, Sudhirkumar Barai Director, BITS Pilani-Pilani Campus
Label: Admin

body: Dear Students, Please go through the following instructions and notice attached herewith for admissions under Dual Degree Scheme. 1. Students who are admitted to any of the Group B Programmes will be eligible for dual degree in one of the programmes of Group A under *=E2=80= =98first priority=E2=80=99*. The assignment of dual degree is done on the basis of performance of the student (progressive Branching Index (PBI)), options given and the availability of seats. Students admitted to the B group programmes in the First Semester of the academic year 2020-2021 may apply for the same as per the *Application Procedure* described below. 2. A limited number of students with high performance can also be considered for dual degrees from Group A to Group A, Group A to Group B, Group A to Group C, Group B to Group B, Group B to Group C. These are called =E2=80=98*other priorities=E2=80=99*. The number of students who may= get a dual degree in any of the programmes will be very limited. In the case of students who want to do a dual degree in Group B, there will be a liberal approach in considering their applications. Students are required to apply as per the procedure described below. *For Transfer:* 3. *Transfer within the same tier*: The Institute=E2=80=99s Academic Regulations allow transfer from one progra= mme to another in limited cases. In the case of Integrated first degree, transfer may be allowed from one programme to another programme within the first-degree programmes. Normally such transfers are done only when the students are exceptionally meritorious. For example: Transfer from B2 =E2= =86=92 B3 or B1 =E2=86=92 A7, A4 =E2=86=92 A8 etc. *4. **Transfer from Integrated First Degree Programme to Higher Degree and/or Ph.D. Programme:* Bright and highly motivated students of Integrated first-degree programme can seek transfer to the higher degree and/or Ph.D. Such a student may also be awarded the intermediate degree(s) upon successful completion of all requirements of the same. Normally such transfers are done at the end of second year or later. However, students who are at earlier stages may also apply to seek counseling in this matter. 5. *Transfer from Higher Degree Programme to Ph.D. Programme:* A higher degree student may be transferred to a Ph.D. programme if found suitable. Such a student may also be awarded the higher degree on successful completion of requirements of the same. *Application Procedure*: Interested and eligible students have to apply online at * < bits-pilani.ac.in/ddtr2021/reg/(bits-pilani.ac.in) < starting from 12th July, 2021 onwards.* After applying online take a print out, put the date, sign it, scan it and email the completed form to ddtr@pilani.bits-pilani.ac.in on or before 25th July 2021 The results will be announced after 31st July 2021. *Best Regards* *Sachin U Belgamwar"*
Label: Admin

body: Notice Emergency Response System Dear Faculty, Staff and Students, On a review of the existing safety and security system in the campus, it was felt that we need a stronger emergency handling/response system. We are happy to announce that the following system has been implemented. In case of medical, fire, safety & security related emergencies, please dial the following numbers: 1. Dial 5555 using the intercom, if you are in any of the Institute buildings. 2. Dial 255555 if you are dialing from a local landline (e.g. BSNL etc.). 3. Dial 01596-255555 if you are calling from a mobile. This call will be attended to on a 24x7 basis. In the unlikely chance of the above call being not responded to within a minute, please call 08529335231 (for medical emergency), 07023476745 (for fire/safety/security related emergencies) Dean Administration BITS-Pilani
Label: Admin

This is to mention that there is *no registration fee charged from BITS Pilani students/ research scholars/faculty colleagues* for this workshop. *For e-certificate of participation you must register yourself for this workshop through an online link given on the website and attend all the sessions.* Kindly visit for further information or mail us on iwradeaa21@gmail.com Team IWRADEAA-2021

body: *BIRLA INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY & SCIENCE, PILANI* *STUDENT WELFARE DIVISION* No. SWD/SCH/73 Dated: May 24, 2021 *NOTICE* *Institute Merit-cum-Need Scholarships, Summer Term/ PS-I, 2020-2021 * Students who would be *registering* for PS-I should note the following procedure for applying for the Institute Merit-cum-Need Scholarships for Summer Term 2020-2021. (Only those registering for the course BITS F221 are eligible). 1. The application should be submitted ON through Google link ( *on* or before *5.00 p.m. Tuesday, 8th June 2021*. Income Tax Return should be submitted through email (mahipal.sharma@pilani.bits-pilani.ac.in) 2. Only those fulfilling the following conditions need apply: (a) Gross annual income of parent(s)/guardian from all sources should be less than the maximum limit prescribed by the Scholarships Committee. Prescribed maximum limit for the current academic year is Rs.*1100000/-. * (b) The scholarships are awarded to students based on CGPA. (c) No NC/E report in the first semester. (d) No case/pending case of indiscipline. (e) Not availing any external scholarship that carries a condition that the student is not receiving any other scholarship. Students are to certify that they are not availing any other scholarship such as Inspire/KVPY etc. Any student availing fee benefit scheme is not eligible. 3. If parent(s)/guardian are salaried persons/Business, Income Tax Return 2020-2021 should be submitted. If parent(s)/guardian are agricultural persons then Tehsildar Certificate is to be submitted. Pensioners should submit a statement from bank/post office from where pension is drawn. No Affidavit will be acceptable as proof of parents income (Assessment Year 2020-2021). Students who have already submitted valid income certificate(s) in the I/II Semester 2020-2021 need not submit again. 4. The Scholarship Committee with the facts at its disposal may use its discretion to determine the genuineness of the certificate. 5. If it is found that any information provided is not true, the applicant will be disqualified. 6. APPLICATIONS RECEIVED AFTER THE LAST DATE WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED. 7. All the columns must be properly completed. INCOMPLETE APPLICATIONS WILL BE REJECTED. 8. Any queries, problems faced should be clarified / cleared before the deadline. (Prof. Srikanta Routroy) Associate Dean Mahipal Sharma Student Welfare Division BITS Pilani, Pilani Campus
Label: Admin

body: Dear Students: In continuation of the previous notice dated May 5, 2021, the off-shoot score for CLEARED grade courses of Semester-II, 2020-21 *for PS-II allotment of Semester-II, 2021-22 and beyond* will be as follows: (i) For the CLEARED grade courses, the mid-semester grades will be directly converted to actual grade points consistent with the minimum-2-points consideration (Mid-semester grade: A will get 10; A- will get 9; B will get 8; B- will get 7; C will get 6; C- will get 5; D will get 4; E will get 2; NC will get 2). . (ii) For the students who have written comprehensive examinations in those courses, the better of the mid-semester grade and the end-semester grade will be considered. Srinivasa Prakash Regalla Dean, Practice School Programmes ------------------------------------------------------------- Dr. Srinivasa Prakash Regalla (PhD, IIT Delhi) Dean (Institute-wide), Practice School Programmes, BITS, Pilani Professor of Mechanical engineering, BITS Pilani, Hyderabad Campus (Off) 040-66303520; (Mob) 9010202879 Email: dean.psd@hyderabad.bits-pilani.ac.in ; regalla@hyderabad.bits-pilani.ac.in Web: ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- On Wed, May 5, 2021 at 11:41 PM Dean Practice School Division < dean.psd@hyderabad.bits-pilani.ac.in> wrote: > *PSD Notice: Off-shoot score points for "Cleared" grade courses of Sem-II, > 2020-21 for PS-II allotment for Sem-1 and Sem-2 sessions of 2021-22* > > Several students have been writing to clarify the off-shoot points for > "Cleared" grade courses (of Sem-II, 2020-21) for the Sem-1 and Sem-2, > 2021-22 sessions of PS-II among the courses prescribed by various PS-II > stations. We are giving the following clarifications. > > * 5 off-shoot points will be given for each "Cleared" grade course for > Sem-1, 2021-22 PS-II allotment, as it has been the standard practice for a > long time, and the same will be extended for "Cleared" grade courses. > * While a minimum of 2 off-shoot points is assured for each "Cleared" > grade course for Sem-II, 2021-22 PS-II allotment, the actual points given > (more and above 2 points) will be calculated based on the mid-semester > grade obtained by the student in those courses. > > Srinivasa Prakash Regalla > Dean, Practice School Programmes > > ------------------------------------------------------------- > Dr. Srinivasa Prakash Regalla (PhD, IIT Delhi) > Dean (Institute-wide), Practice School Programmes, BITS, Pilani > Professor of Mechanical engineering, BITS Pilani, Hyderabad Campus > (Off) 040-66303520; (Mob) 9010202879 > Email: dean.psd@hyderabad.bits-pilani.ac.in ; > regalla@hyderabad.bits-pilani.ac.in > Web: > > ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- >

body: Dear Students: In continuation of the previous notice dated May 5, 2021, the off-shoot score for CLEARED grade courses of Semester-II, 2020-21 *for PS-II allotment of Semester-II, 2021-22 and beyond* will be as follows: (i) For the CLEARED grade courses, the mid-semester grades will be directly converted to actual grade points consistent with the minimum-2-points consideration (Mid-semester grade: A will get 10; A- will get 9; B will get 8; B- will get 7; C will get 6; C- will get 5; D will get 4; E will get 2; NC will get 2). . (ii) For the students who have written comprehensive examinations in those courses, the better of the mid-semester grade and the end-semester grade will be considered. Srinivasa Prakash Regalla Dean, Practice School Programmes ------------------------------------------------------------- Dr. Srinivasa Prakash Regalla (PhD, IIT Delhi) Dean (Institute-wide), Practice School Programmes, BITS, Pilani Professor of Mechanical engineering, BITS Pilani, Hyderabad Campus (Off) 040-66303520; (Mob) 9010202879 Email: dean.psd@hyderabad.bits-pilani.ac.in ; regalla@hyderabad.bits-pilani.ac.in Web: ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- > > > On Wed, May 5, 2021 at 11:41 PM Dean Practice School Division < > dean.psd@hyderabad.bits-pilani.ac.in> wrote: > >> *PSD Notice: Off-shoot score points for "Cleared" grade courses of >> Sem-II, 2020-21 for PS-II allotment for Sem-1 and Sem-2 sessions of 2021-22* >> >> Several students have been writing to clarify the off-shoot points for >> "Cleared" grade courses (of Sem-II, 2020-21) for the Sem-1 and Sem-2, >> 2021-22 sessions of PS-II among the courses prescribed by various PS-II >> stations. body: *PSD Notice: Off-shoot score points for "Cleared" grade courses of Sem-II, 2020-21 for PS-II allotment for Sem-1 and Sem-2 sessions of 2021-22* Several students have been writing to clarify the off-shoot points for "Cleared" grade courses (of Sem-II, 2020-21) for the Sem-1 and Sem-2, 2021-22 sessions of PS-II among the courses prescribed by various PS-II stations. We are giving the following clarifications. * 5 off-shoot points will be given for each "Cleared" grade course for Sem-1, 2021-22 PS-II allotment, as it has been the standard practice for a long time, and the same will be extended for "Cleared" grade courses. * While a minimum of 2 off-shoot points is assured for each "Cleared" grade course for Sem-II, 2021-22 PS-II allotment, the actual points given (more and above 2 points) will be calculated based on the mid-semester grade obtained by the student in those courses. Srinivasa Prakash Regalla Dean, Practice School Programmes ------------------------------------------------------------- Dr. Srinivasa Prakash Regalla (PhD, IIT Delhi) Dean (Institute-wide), Practice School Programmes, BITS, Pilani Professor of Mechanical engineering, BITS Pilani, Hyderabad Campus (Off) 040-66303520; (Mob) 9010202879 Email: dean.psd@hyderabad.bits-pilani.ac.in ; regalla@hyderabad.bits-pilani.ac.in Web: ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

body: Dear Students, The Institute=E2=80=99s Academic Regulations allow transfer of bright and h= ighly motivated students to the Higher Degree / Ph.D. Programme. Students, *graduating in May 2021* and interested in admission to the Higher Degree/ Ph.D. programme may do so by seeking a transfer to the same. A graduating Student of a particular campus can seek for a transfer to a higher degree programme offered at that campus. A Student can also seek a transfer to a Higher Degree program offered at the other campus if that particular programme is not offered in his/her campus. Notification of transfer along with application form are enclosed along with this email. The last date of application is *31st May, 2021 (5.00 PM).= * Best wishes, FIC, HD & PhD Admissions

body: The country has witnessed an alarming increase in Covid-19 cases in the last few days including Rajasthan. Kindly note there were only 60 new infected cases on a single day on February 16 in the state, but it rose to 1,350 cases on April 1. On February 23, the total active cases were 1,195, but on April 1, the number increased to 9,563. All of you will agree that campus has been reasonably safe and secured due to discipline from the campus residents. Now, tts high time that we become all the more cautious. Hence, in order to keep our campus safe, cooperation from all residents is required. As a precautionary measure, the following steps will be implemented with immediate effect. (1) Students will not be allowed to go outside the campus, except for a medical emergency. (2) All cycles of student entry will remain suspended till further notice. If a student decides to go home for any reason, he will not be allowed to come back till further orders. (3) The BITS faculty, staff, and their family members are discouraged to leave the campus except for medical emergencies, to be approved by CMO. (4) The BITS faculty, staff, and their family members coming from another city have to produce a COVID- negative report (not older than 72 Hrs) of RT-PCR or the final certificate of vaccination. In absence of such a report, they have to meet the campus doctor and remain home isolated for 15 days. (5) It is necessary for all visitors/Vendor/ technicians/supplier/ service engineer, coming from other cities, to produce Covid- negative report not older than 72 Hrs failing which the entry to the campus will be denied. It=E2=80=99s the most critical time for all of us and hence, together we ca= n save the community from this pandemic. Looking forward to your full cooperation. Thanking you in anticipation. Team CRT
Label: Admin

body: *BIRLA INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY AND SCIENCE, PILANI* *AUGS/AGSR DIVISION* * Notice Regarding Make-Up Application* The Make-up application process for the Mid-Semester/ Comprehensive Examinations has been *made online in *AUGSD-AGSRD website ( Following are the important points in this regard: 1. All students must write the Mid-Semester/ Comprehensive examinations. 2. Students must note that the Make-up will be given only in genuine cases after thorough examination of the application. 3. In case of extreme emergency, where make-up is sought, a student can submit an online application using the AUGSD-AGSRD website ( *prior or within 3 days of exam*. 4. Note that applications submitted in the hard copy/ via email will *NOT* be entertained. 5. Once a student will submit a make-up application, the Instructor-in-charge (IC) will receive an auto-generated email for further necessary action(s) on it. 6. The IC can ask the student to update the make-up application/ schedule personal interaction with the student before taking final decision/ approve or reject the make-up application by mentioning specific remarks through his/her AUGSD-AGSRD website portal. In each case, an auto-generated email will be sent to the student. 7. As per the Institute Academic Regulation, the decision of the IC in all matters of make-up shall be final. 8. In case, the IC rejects the make-up application, as per the Institute Academic Regulation, a student will be reported NC (Not cleared) for that particular course. *Associate Deans*
Label: Admin

body: *BIRLA INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY & SCIENCE, PILANI CAMPUS* *REGISTRATION & COUNSELING* *SECOND SEMESTER 2020-21* Date: 27.01.2021 *ADDITION / SUBSTITUTION* =C3=98 The online process for addition/ substitution for *First Degree and Higher Degree students* is scheduled during *January 27, 2021 (starting from 10AM) to January 30, 2021 (up to 11:59PM). * =C3=98 The list of seats available for addition/ substitution in various Elective courses is *available in AUGS-AGSR Division website (* You can apply for other course(s) also which are not mentioned in the list, however, registration will only be allowed in case of availability of seats vacating due to substituting out by other students in that course(s). *Procedure for Addition/Substitution of course* Addition/Substitution requests will be accepted through *AUGS-AGSR Division website.* =C2=B7 The criteria for the addition/ substitution of course(s) will= be as follows: o As per the semester wise pattern for First Degree students of various disciplines, requests for the Humanities elective courses will be processed in the order starting from second year to final year based on the priority number (*reverse order*) of a student. o Requests for the discipline and open elective courses (other than Humanities) will be processed in the order starting from final year to second year based on the priority number (*reverse order*) of a student. For a particular course, first preference will be given to the student of same discipline followed by minor student (if any) and then others. o Students should ensure that the requested course for addition/ substitution fits in their existing Time Table without any clash. Addition/ substitution request will automatically stand cancel if it creates clash in Time Table. =C2=B7 *Compulsory (Core) courses are not allowed for substitution. = * =C2=B7 It is individual student=E2=80=99s responsibility, to ensure = the eligibility for the course as well as graduation requirements (in terms of number of units and number of courses). =C2=B7 *Check your final course package for the semester after compl= etion of addition/ substitution exercise by 5 PM on February 3, 2021. * best wishes *Faculty In-charge, Registration & Counselling* Birla Institute of Technology & Science (BITS), Pilani Pilani Campus, Vidya Vihar Pilani - 333031, Rajasthan, India Phone No. :+91-1596-515220/243 Fax No. :+91-1596-244183

body: Greetings from *Student Alumni Relations Cell*! We understand that Batch Snaps and the Yearbook are an integral part of every BITSian=E2=80=99s Life and capture the nostalgic memories of the grad= uating batch. The eventful years spent on the campus with seniors, batchmates and juniors turn into lifelong friendships. The Yearbook and Photos are what capture these memories for years to come. Traditionally, the Batch Snaps are held in the second semester of your pre-final year. However, due to COVID, they were not organized for the past two years. With things being normalized and students back on campus, the Student Alumni Relations Cell is elated to announce that we are organizing the Batch Snaps for FD Batch of 2018 (Single Degree and Dual Degree Students), HD Batch of 2020 and MBA Batch of 2020, tentatively on 19th, 20th and 21st November 2021 (Friday, Saturday and Sunday). This has been planned after extensive discussion and proper permissions from the administration and Director. According to your branch, they will be organized in slots, and every student participating in the Batch Snaps will have to *strictly follow all mandated guidelines*. A comprehensive document will be soon shared with detailed instructions, guidelines and schedule. This mail has been sent so that students can plan their leaves accordingly if they wish to participate in the Batch Snaps. The snaps will be organized on the dates mentioned above unless communicated otherwise due to unavoidable circumstances. Please note that you would be only allowed to enter the venue in your designated slots, and this will be organized just for the students of the graduating batch who are on campus. We are aware that some 2018 FD Single Degree Students are on PS-2. For such students, we would probably organize them next semester if the conditions allow. Please find attached a Document < =3Dsharing> with some frequently asked questions. We encourage you to contact the undersigned if you have any other doubts: Yash Thakker: +91 9725791724 Vidushi Sahay: +91 9871941631 *Regards,* *Student Alumni Relations Cell*
Label: Recreation
