body: Hi AYUSH, If I handed you a big bucket of assorted LEGO bricks, how would you separat= e them into different piles? By color? Shape? Size? Just like LEGOs, your p= rojects & tasks have different characteristics too: status, importance, urg= ency... With Notion 2.13, you can create groups of items in your databases to get o= rganized on your own terms =E2=80=94 in whatever way makes sense to your br= ain. Try it out ( 2C+personal%2C+version+A&utm_campaigntype=3Dnewsletter&utm_content=3D2.12+r= elease+email%2C+personal%2C+version+A&utm_medium=3Demail&utm_source=3Dcusto= mer.io ) (1) Create groups in Timeline, Table, List & Gallery views Click the new Group button to visually organize your content by whatever pr= operty makes sense for your workflow. Each group includes a toggle to the l= eft, so you can quickly hide and show groups to focus on what you need. (2) Create groups and sub-groups in Board view Already grouping your tasks in Board view? Now you can create sub-groups of= those tasks organized by any other property, all while keeping your origin= al columns intact. (3) Group by more properties, including Relation properties Before, you could only group your items based off of Select, Multi-select, = and Person properties. Now nearly every property type is supported, includi= ng Relation, Number, Date and more. (4) More features we launched this month We're always improving Notion based on your feedback. Here's the latest: * Bullet lists now default to alternating between discs, circles & squares = at each level of indentation * You can now show & hide all database properties with one click in the "Pr= operties" dropdown menu * On mobile, tap the =F0=9F=92=AC icon at the top right to see a consolidat= ed view of comments (5) Notion is now available in Japanese We're excited to take a big step toward making Notion feel native and intui= tive to millions more people. Starting now, Japanese language is available = in beta! Go to Settings & members =E2=86=92 Language & region to change your languag= e on desktop, or your device settings to change your language on mobile. Learn more =E2=86=92 ( ese?utm_campaign=3D2.13+release+email%2C+personal%2C+version+A&utm_campaign= type=3Dnewsletter&utm_content=3D2.12+release+email%2C+personal%2C+version+A= &utm_medium=3Demail&utm_source=3Dcustomer.io ) Personally, I would sort a big bucket of LEGOs by color, but you might thin= k about organization differently. That's the beauty of grouping in Notion = =E2=80=94 everyone can create processes & systems to meet their own needs, = with more flexibility than ever before. Wishing you a crisp and restful end to your October, wherever you are. Warmly, Ivan Co-founder & CEO P.S. We are looking for lots of software engineers, recruiters, sales folks= & more ( 3a4965d7b15a?utm_campaign=3D2.13+release+email%2C+personal%2C+version+A&utm= _campaigntype=3Dnewsletter&utm_content=3D2.12+release+email%2C+personal%2C+= version+A&utm_medium=3Demail&utm_source=3Dcustomer.io ). Know anyone? Notion ( l%2C+version+A&utm_campaigntype=3Dnewsletter&utm_content=3D2.12+release+ema= il%2C+personal%2C+version+A&utm_medium=3Demail&utm_source=3Dcustomer.io ) Notion.so ( onal%2C+version+A&utm_campaigntype=3Dnewsletter&utm_content=3D2.12+release+= email%2C+personal%2C+version+A&utm_medium=3Demail&utm_source=3Dcustomer.io = ), the all-in-one workspace for your notes, tasks, wikis, and databases. 548 Market St #74567, San Francisco, CA 94104 Unsubscribe ( QApv1w=3D=3D )
Label: Spam

body: Ramesh, Ek Coding Challenge jeetne ki keemat kya tum jaante ho Ramesh babu…….. PPO ka aashirwad deta hai ek coding challenge……… CV ke sar ka taj hota hai ek coding challenge………. Har engineer ka khwab hota hai ek coding challenge………. jeetna! We know it’s easier said than done to stand out amongst your peers, par woh kehte hain na… ki agar kisi cheez ko dil se chaaho toh puri kayanat usey tumse milane ki koshish mein lag jaati hai. So don’t you worry because this time the kayanat has got you covered. We bring to you a challenge which will open all the doors for you, a challenge which will give you all the things we just mentioned above and even a cash prize of up to INR 1,75,000/- Philips Code to Care Challenge 2021: Toh jao Ramesh jee lo apni zindagi Apply Now! : We wish you all the very best. Regards, Dare2Compete Team
Label: Spam

body: Join us for a Live Master Class with Mudit Goel! ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ​ Hi there! Being a Data Scientist or a Machine Learning Engineer is a prestigious career. Almost every organisation across the globe seeks a team of skilled professionals who can work on their data and help in growing their business. But, when everyone is preparing to become a Data Scientist or a Machine Learning Engineer, how can you stand out from the crowd? Join Mudit Goel, Product & Strategy Head, Scaler Data Science, in a LIVE Masterclass on October 26, 2021, Tuesday, at 8 PM IST, where you will learn how Scaler Data Science can help you achieve your dream of becoming a Sought-after Data Scientist.   Register For Free   Key Takeaways From This Masterclass: What defines a Sought-After Data Scientist from the regular ones What is currently missing in Data Science Bootcamps & how Scaler solves that problem Career opportunities in Data Science & Machine Learning disciplines Why Data Science teams of various top companies are willing to hire Scaler graduates Copyright © 2021 Scaler.com, All rights reserved You are getting this mail because your e-mail ID is registered with us. body: Everything you need to know! ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ Binary is one of the most important foundational aspects of computers and other digital systems. As we humans use languages to understand and communicate with each other, Computers and other Digital Systems use Binary. It is a base-2 number system having only two numbers, 0 & 1 which corresponds to ON & OFF states that your computer can understand. As normal humans have 10 fingers to represent a simple number system called Decimal, computers have these ON & OFF states representing Binary. So to understand and interpret the binary we need some technique to convert binary code into decimal (human-readable) code and vice versa. Thus in this article, we will discuss how to convert decimal to binary and vice versa, in context with one of the computer programming language-Python. Understanding Decimal and Binary Decimal System(Base-10) makes use of ten numbers ranging from 0 to 9 and then uses their combinations to form digits, with each digit being worth ten times more than the last digit (1, 10, 100, so-on) going from left to right. Consider a value 265: Here 265 is a combination for numbers ranging from 0 to 9 to form each digit Each digit is ten times more than the last digit going from left to right 5 -> 5×100;  6 -> 6×101;  2 -> 2×102 Binary System(Base-2) is also similar, it is a combination of numbers 0 or 1 with each digit being worth two times more than the last digit(1, 2, 4, so-on) going from left to right. Decimal Digit Representation: … [0 to 9] [0 to 9] [0 to 9] [0 to 9] [0 to 9] … 104 103 102 101 100 Nth digit 5th digit 4th digit 3rd digit 2nd digit 1st digit Similarly, Binary Digit Representation: … [0 to 1] [0 to 1] [0 to 1] [0 to 1] [0 to 1] … 24 23 22 21 20 Nth digit 5th digit 4th digit 3rd digit 2nd digit 1st digit Binary to Decimal Conversion in Python We have already seen that the Binary System is a combination of [0 or 1] with each digit being worth two times more than the last digit, so let’s see how this information will help us to convert binary to decimal equivalent. Consider a Binary Number 01011 Digit 0 1 0 1 1 Weight 24=16 23=8 22=4 21=2 20=1 Hence, (01011)2 = ( 0x24) + (1×23) + (0x22) + (1×21) + (1×20) =(0) + (8) + (0) + (2) + (1) =(11)10 Therefore, the binary(base-2) (01011)2 is equivalent to (11)10 Decimal(base-10) number.   Read On   Decimal to Binary Conversion in Python Let’s try to understand the decimal to binary conversion. The easiest technique to convert the decimal numbers to their binary equivalent is the Division by 2. In Division by 2 technique, we continuously divide a decimal number by 2 and note the reminder, till we get 1 as our input value, and then we read the noted reminders in reverse order to get the final binary value. Let’s break the earlier statements to get more clarity. Assume we have a special function that divides the input number by 2 and gives the remainder as output. For decimal to binary, we call this special function multiple times till we get the 1 as input value. Then, at last, we print all the saved reminders to get the final binary(base-2) value. Read On Copyright © 2021 Scaler.com, All rights reserved You are getting this mail because your e-mail ID is registered with us. To stop receiving these mails click- Unsubscribe .
Label: Spam

We =0Arecommend a mor= e targeted approach to save yourself the pain, and save =0Arecruiters the t= ime to review resumes. Make it as clear and as easy as possibl= e for them to =0Aidentify you as a potential fit.=0A=0A=C2=A0=0A=0A- Your F= riends at Smartr=0AUpdate Smartr Profile < =0A=0A=0A= =0A < =0A< /smartrecruiters/> =0A< =0A< ww.facebook.com/SmartRecruiters> =0APrivacy Policy < /c0H02HCN0dSI0qMCi0Pvy00>=C2=A0|=C2=A0=0ATerms & Conditions < //smart.smartrecruiters.com/K00HHNI00dyw2jMPC0qS0C0>=0ASmartRecruiters, Inc= . - San Francisco - California - USA=0A-=0ADon't want to receive these ema= ils anymore=3F Unsubscribe =0A< be=3F_r=3Db2e2177bebfd4f68b48c25d97cf1d54f&_s=3Dff83da4d2d1848a09d5bbd4030f= 55e96&_t=3DdAVAq9DlGOPTXm-vYsF_Qau6HN8Qh2rtpJzc2HoIu3DXcLySGCy0Pf9X0_zS3buj= -4hKezbV7b6j3imlHKMEw4P8zvxCOkVOByAE9Ui92fMSGunGJKNOxyHoh4MT-B8JvoeJhNwzslN= FYnw7u4aUobZz4Z_gKyt_95Kq66rd12qldR_q_6IfnQ2fQ_oKZZ9F3oM1SvDIEXciABd84N5Ydq= ZxykmtbcxFHxEG4-e_IMRDsNgy28AAhyCAbjG9Zcqg>=0A=C2=A0=0A =0A< martr.me/e/evib=3F_t=3Db2e2177bebfd4f68b48c25d97cf1d54f&_m=3Dff83da4d2d1848= a09d5bbd4030f55e96&_e=3DdAVAq9DlGOPTXm-vYsF_Qau6HN8Qh2rtpJzc2HoIu3DXcLySGCy= 0Pf9X0_zS3buj2hdbuaQ41hwDm9-e7Y6YqDWiHjUDpTMtsvDyH_sa39gEsAzG2fgesxCmq5h4P8= gxR4D-ehg8wibEwAYvKo533w%3D%3D>=0AView Online =0A< /evib=3F_t=3Db2e2177bebfd4f68b48c25d97cf1d54f&_m=3Dff83da4d2d1848a09d5bbd40= 30f55e96&_e=3DdAVAq9DlGOPTXm-vYsF_Qau6HN8Qh2rtpJzc2HoIu3DXcLySGCy0Pf9X0_zS3= buj2hdbuaQ41hwDm9-e7Y6YqDWiHjUDpTMtsvDyH_sa39gEsAzG2fgesxCmq5h4P8gxR4D-ehg8= wibEwAYvKo533w%3D%3D>

body: Space is limited for some sessions and other fun ways to engage ( ww.githubuniverse.com/?utm_source=3Dannouncement&utm_medium=3Demail&utm_cam= paign=3D2021-WW-Dev-Announcement&utm_content=3DWays-to-engage ) GitHub Universe is only a week away. Check out the schedule and start bookm= arking sessions before it's too late. The livestream starts at 8 am PDT on October 27 and kicks off with a specia= l musical performance followed by an opening keynote from GitHub CEO Nat Fr= iedman at 8:30 am PDT. Space is limited for interactive sessions following the livestream, so take= a look at the schedule ( source=3Dannouncement&utm_medium=3Demail&utm_campaign=3D2021-WW-Dev-Announc= ement&utm_content=3DWays-to-engage&utm_cta=3Dschedule ) and save your spot = now. All on demand sessions will be available following the day 1 keynote. = Watch the sessions when it works best for you. View the schedule ( =3Dannouncement&utm_medium=3Demail&utm_campaign=3D2021-WW-Dev-Announcement&= utm_content=3DWays-to-engage&utm_cta=3Dmain ) With over 60 conference sessions, you can build your very own Universe expe= rience. Get started creating your customized schedule now. Looking for other fun ways to engage with the global developer community du= ring Universe? Here are just a few: * Host a watch party with your friends or colleagues. We=E2=80=99ve put tog= ether a kit to help you get started, full of tips and tools to experience U= niverse together * If you=E2=80=99re tuning in on your own, the Watch Party Kit still includ= es resources to enhance your Universe experience * Hop into a virtual focus space, featuring science-backed beats to help yo= u recharge throughout the event Head over to ( =3Dannouncement&utm_medium=3Demail&utm_campaign=3D2021-WW-Dev-Announcement&= utm_content=3DWays-to-engageutm_cta=3Dsite_url ) for more information on ho= w to create your own personal Universe. Save your seat ( utm_medium=3Demail&utm_campaign=3D2021-WW-Dev-Announcement&utm_content=3DWa= ys-to-engageutm_cta=3Dsave_your_seat ) See you next week! body: New Plans and Pricing=0A=0A=0AWe are continuously adding capabilities to ou= r platform=E2=80=94based on what you, our =0Acustomers, need=E2=80=94servin= g everyone from individual developers to large =0Aenterprises with thousand= s and thousands of developers.=0A=0A We love developers and we=E2=80=99ve a= dded great tools and functionality over the =0Alast 18 months including the= Postman v9 update in September, API Builder, =0Apublic workspaces, and muc= h more.=0A=0A Over the years, enterprises have also become key customers. P= ostman =0Arecognizes that enterprises have significant needs beyond those o= f smaller =0Ateams of developers, and we=E2=80=99ve made massive investment= s this year to address =0Athose needs, too.=0A=0A To keep up with the custo= mers we serve, we=E2=80=99re making several =0Aupdates=E2=80=94including ne= w names and new pricing for some Postman plans.=0A=0A Postman Co-Founder an= d CEO Abhinav Asthana=E2=80=99s new blog post =0A< announcing-postman-plans-and-pricing-2021> has all =0Athe details, and we e= ncourage you to take a look. And yes, we will continue to =0Aoffer a Free p= lan for teams of up to three. (If you are thinking about =0Aupgrading, now = is a good time!)=0A=0A We'll follow up shortly with your admins about all c= hanges specific to your =0Aplan. Got questions=3F Send an email tohelp@post= =0Aand we=E2=80=99ll get back to you.=0A= =0A As always, thanks for being a part of the Postman community.=0A=0A; =0A= Read the Blog Post =0A< d-pricing-2021> =0A=0A=0A=0A=0A=0A=C2=A9 2021 Postman Inc.=C2=A0All Rights = Reserved=0A 55 2nd Street, Suite 300, San Francisco, CA 94105
Label: Spam

body: Dear Catalysts, Optum Stratethon Season 3 is here and it is time to get your game on! Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, is excited to bring you Stratethon Season 3, an international-level challenge for the B-School and E-School students across India, Philippines, Singapore, Hong Kong, Vietnam, and Malaysia. Just 2 days are left to join Optum on this journey to help improve the lives of millions around the world and get ready to do your life’s best work.℠ Eligibility Criteria: This challenge is open to full-time 2-year MBA/PGDM students from a select list of B-Schools and full-time B.Tech/B.E. students from select engineering colleges, across specializations. Rewards & Prizes: The regional winners from the Business and Engineering track will get prize money worth $6700 each. The regional runners-up from the Business and Engineering track will get prize money worth $3000 each. The finalists to receive Pre-Placement Interviews (*subject to Terms & Conditions) at Optum. All college winners to receive certificates. Register Now: It is time to balance the scales of the health care sector. Bring your ‘A’ game to do your life’s best work.℠ Best, Team Optum
Label: Spam

body: deepnote logo ********************************* Product updates from Deepnote =E2=9C=A8 ********************************* Happy October! Today, we're announcing exciting new integrations in Deepnot= e - you can now connect to your MySQL and Amazon Athena instances and use t= hem to bring SQL into your notebooks. We're also launching Okta integration= and a new way to sort your projects. As always, if you'd like to get a demo of the new features, join us for the= New in Deepnote session on Thursday, November 4 at 9am PT / 4pm UTC (RSVP = here ( )). Let's dive in! ********************************** =F0=9F=90=AC Connect to MySQL & Athena ********************************** MySQL + Athena integrations screenshot Our list of integrations is growing! You can now connect to your MySQL and = Amazon Athena instances and query data with SQL cells, right within your no= tebook. This is a powerful feature - when you run SQL queries in Deepnote, = you can assign and store resulting dataframes in Python variables, and use = advanced templating blocks inside of SQL. Take it for a spin - in this vide= o ( ), Liz show= s you how! You can find the full list of existing integrations and tutorials on how to= use them here ( ). ************************** =F0=9F=94=93 Sign in with Okta SSO ************************** Okta integration screenshot Deepnote now integrates with Okta for a more secure sign-in process. If you= 'd like to enable it for your team or organization, you can learn more abou= t the set up process here ( ). This feature is exclusive to Deepnote Enterprise plan users. You can learn = more about our full offering and schedule a live demo here ( /pricing ). ************************************ =F0=9F=A7=BD Sort projects in your dashboard ************************************ sorting projects screenshot You can now sort projects in your dashboard by recent edits or time they we= re created. No more scrolling through stale or old projects! ********************************** =F0=9F=90=9B Bugfixes & smaller things ********************************** * We have increased the allowed runtime of published projects to 2 minutes.= Do let us know if you still happen to run into difficulties here! * Projects will no longer keep running when your browser tab is open. This = means that a project will be shut down if there is no activity for 15 minut= es (i.e., code execution or editing). If you are using out non-standard mac= hines ( ), yo= u can customize or prolong the inactivity period. You can read more about u= pdates in runtime conditions in our docs ( nment/long-running-jobs ). * We have added the option to import your project from Google Drive when yo= u create a new notebook. * If you hover over a cell, you will now see an option to add a new comment= on the top right. * When the load on our infrastructure is high, we will let you know via an = in-app message that scheduling a new machine for your project might take a = bit more time. * We fixed the bug where pressing Escape did not close the underlying modal= or dialog, but instead opened the Command Palette ( com/features/command-palette ). Have a great weekend & see you back here in 2 weeks! Jakub & the Deepnote team =F0=9F=91=8B =C2=A9 2021 Deepnote, Inc. All rights reserved. 651 N. Broad Street, Suite 206, Middletown, DE 19709, USA Unsubscribe ( dcdo4w=3D=3D ) from future emails like this.
Label: Spam

Hopefully we=E2=80=99re going to make that = =0Aexperience easier for you here on out.=0A=0A=C2=A0=0A=0ANow that you=E2= =80=99ve set off on this journey, you have to ask yourself one =0Aquestion:= Is this job in line with your career goals=3F Consider this:=0A=0A * It=E2= =80=99s not just about salary: Does the role provide new responsibilities= =3F =0AWill it challenge you to grow =0A * Reverse engineer your path: Is t= he role a stepping stone to your ultimate =0Acareer goal =0ARemember, your = time counts. body: Dear Students, This is for your information. Thanks & Regards Dean AUGS ---------------------------------------------------------------------------= ------------------------------------------------------------------------- Dear Student, This is to notify you all that the internship has been *postponed to January* post discussion regarding student examinations in the month of December. *Inviting all applicants* who missed out on the internship application due to prior communication of internship commencement, to enroll for the internship. This LIVE online internship enables you to apply your knowledge of Deep Learning to solve real-world problems and work on innovative projects mentored directly by *HPE's industry experts and trainers.* *Internship takeaways:* 1. Work on industry projects in Python, TensorFlow, and Keras to deepen real-world understanding 2. Design your Neural Network from scratch 3. Learn advanced Deep Learning applications: Regularization methods, Hyper Parameter Tuning, Time Series Analysis 4. Design and deploy deep learning solutions in Computer Vision (CV) and Natural Language Processing (NLP) 5. Simulate industry project team scenario and get trained on DevOps Azure *It=E2=80=99s crucial to have an edge in recruitment, or when you=E2=80=99r= e applying for your masters. Here=E2=80=99s a look at some of our alumni.* 1. *Anubha Kabra*, a graduate of *Delhi Technological University (DTU)*, is currently working as a *software engineer at Adobe*. Read more about her journey here < nship-india> . 2. Sarthak Goel, a graduate from *Birla Institute of Technology and Science Pilani (BITS Pilani), Goa *is currently working as an analyst at Goldman Sachs. 3. *Shaolin Kataria, *a graduate of *VIT, Vellore*, shares his experience of *interning at NUS*. You can get to know more about it here= . < experience> *Schedule: * 1. *The HPEDL LIVE Online starts January 2022. * 2. *8-weeks *with LIVE sessions over *Wednesday and Saturday (4 hours each) * 3. * Internship Fee- 799 SGD Only * Please refer to the attached brochure for further reference. Feel free to write back with any queries. If you want to enroll, for the internship click here. < To INQUIRE, for the internship click here < m/formperma/hA5EQjQmcNH3SwOhEEBz4CGHd2PRhG0Zk03s5BrQlyw> . See y'all there! Kind Regards Divya Radhakrishnan Business Leader Graduate Leadership Academy Corporate Gurukul Singapore | India | UAE www.corporategurukul.com | *divya.radhakrishnan@corporategurukul.com * The information contained in this electronic communication is intended solely for the individual(s) or entity to which it is addressed. It may contain proprietary, confidential and/or legally privileged information. Any review, retransmission, dissemination, printing, copying or other use of, or taking any action in reliance on the contents of this information by person(s) or entities other than the intended recipient is strictly prohibited and may be unlawful. If you have received this communication in error, please notify us by responding to this email or telephone and immediately and permanently delete all copies of this message and any attachments from your system(s). The contents of this message do not necessarily represent the views or policies of BITS Pilani.
Label: Intern/Placement

body: Dear Students Pl. see the forwarded email regarding 'Anubhav Fellowship' Thanks & Regards SM -------- Forwarded Message -------- Subject: Anubhav Fellowship Date: Wed, 3 Nov 2021 11:47:36 +0530 From: iHub - IITMandi To: sudeeptm@pilani.bits-pilani.ac.in Dear Sir/Madam, IIT Mandi iHub and HCI Foundation (iHub) has launched Anubhav Fellowship for undergraduate students across India. The fellowship is intended to encourage students to work in HCI and BCI domains. As part of this, students are encouraged to submit their ideas for selection for the fellowship. The fellowship is targeted at undergraduate students to encourage them to work in the fields of Human Computer Interaction, Brain Computer Interface, Multimedia Forensics, AR/VR, Multisensory Systems, etc. iHub would be happy to have students from your institute/college apply for this fellowship. We request you to kindly post the advertisement of Anubhav Fellowship on your notice boards, websites and share it with students via email and encourage your students to submit their ideas for fellowship. The details of the fellowship are also at available at Students can submit their ideas at before November 10, 2021. Thanks. With Best Regards Avinash PUNEKAR CEO IIT Mandi iHub and HCI Foundation -- This email has been checked for viruses by AVG. -- Thanks & regards Dept. of Computer Science & Information Systems BITS-Pilani-333031
Label: Intern/Placement

body: Dear BITSians Greetings of the day and Happy Diwali! To promote API Literacy and API-First Principles amongst BITS students, *Postman* < z=3D1&usg=3DAFQjCNFmQkxTMYeuI9cR0oeNR7Xns0fZXw>, a BITS Alumnus startup turned Unicorn (and a Pioneer in API Industry), is offering an "*API-based Programming Course"* to all BITSians across all four campuses. The course shall be offered *online* and is *free of cost!* It shall give an opportunity to all BITSians to learn API-based programming, which is currently being offered to leading institutions globally! The course is a three module course, and has no pre-requisites. All registered students will get a *certificate of completion* and *free access= * to Postman License worth *$828/year/user.* The number of seats is limited to 500 across all the campuses. Registrations on a *first-come-first-serve* basis. The course starts from *10 November 2021*. The details of the live sessions shall be shared with the registered students. For registrations and course details please visit Hurry! Limited seats available! For queries you can drop an email to queries@bits-postman-lab.in. Best Regards Team =E2=80=93 BITS Pilani Postman Classroom Program
Label: Intern/Placement

body: Dear all, Attaching an internship posting from Titan Capital below for your reference. *Please note that this opportunity is NOT engaged with the Placement Unit of BITS Pilani in any way. This is an off-campus opportunity and the PU, BITS Pilani holds NO liability for it. * *If you have any questions or concerns about the opportunity, you must reach out to abhishek@titancapital.vc only. * ---------------------------------------------------------------------------= ------------------------------ Hi everyone, This is regarding a part-time *internship opportunity* with a* Titan Capital portfolio company*. *Titan Capital* < ttps%3A%2F%2Ftitancapital.vc%2F> (titancapital.vc < ttps%3A%2F%2Ftitancapital.vc%2F> ) is an early-stage venture capital fund based out of Gurgaon. Some of our key investments include Ola, UrbanClap, Razorpay, Mamaearth, GoMechanic, Khatabook, and Pepper. *Work Description*: The project involves working with the founders of an idea-stage Titan portfolio startup. The startup is in the D2C e-commerce sector (currently in stealth). Idea stage is the first pre-product stage of a company. It involves rigorous analysis of the sector and benchmarking existing competitors in the market. You will be working directly with the founder and the Titan Capital team on market research, rapid experimentation and zero-to-one initiatives. *Other Details*: Students in pre-final or final year are eligible. Prior experience in early-stage startups is preferred. The internship tenure is 3-4 months but can be extended later on. This is a part-time internship so it can be done in parallel with your academic term. There will be an interview round after resume shortlisting. Work begins as soon as you're hired :) Deadline to apply: 10th November, 2021 Internship Stipend: =E2=82=B920K/month To apply, please fill this form: < ttps%3A%2F%2Fforms.gle%2FqSnF2zJ6wEJea4fm7> *If you have any questions, please reach out at abhishek@titancapital.vc * Anyone interested in a role with the founding team at an early-stage startup is encouraged to apply! ---------------------------------------------------------------------------= -------------------------- DO NOT RESPOND TO THIS EMAIL. --=20 Warm regards, *Sanskriti Jindal* Email: Personal E-mail , University E-mail Phone- +91-8826640597 *=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84= =E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2= =96=84=E2=96=84**=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2= =96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96= =84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84**=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96= =84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84= =E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84* *Birla Institute of Technology & Science,* *Pilani* Pilani Campus, Rajasthan - 333 031, INDIA.

body: Anubhav Fellowship Programme Dear Students Pl. see details in the forwarded email. Thanks SM - -------- Forwarded Message -------- Subject: Anubhav Fellowship Programme Date: Fri, 29 Oct 2021 13:24:03 +0530 From: Arvind Sharma To: sudeeptm@pilani.bits-pilani.ac.in Dear Sir/Madam, IIT Mandi iHub and HCI Foundation (iHub) has launched Anubhav Fellowship for undergraduate students across India. The fellowship is intended to encourage students to work in HCI and BCI domains. As part of this, students are encouraged to submit their ideas for selection for the fellowship. The fellowship is targeted at undergraduate students to encourage them to work in the fields of Human Computer Interaction, Brain Computer Interface, Multimedia Forensics, AR/VR, Multisensory Systems, etc. iHub would be happy to have students from your institute/college apply for this fellowship. We request you to kindly post the advertisement of Anubhav Fellowship on your notice boards, websites and share it with students via email and encourage your students to submit their ideas for fellowship. The details of the fellowship are also at available at Students can submit their ideas at before November 10, 2021. Thanks. With Best Regards Avinash PUNEKAR CEO IIT Mandi iHub and HCI Foundation -- This email has been checked for viruses by AVG. -- Thanks & regards Dept. of Computer Science & Information Systems BITS-Pilani-333031
Label: Intern/Placement

body: Dear All, Greetings from Practice School Division. Practice School-I (PS-I) is an integral part of the curriculum of BITS Pilani, offered to First Degree students at the end of their second year of the degree programme, during the summer. PS-I is an exposure-oriented course of an eight-week duration, the goal of which is to provide students an opportunity to observe how the workplace functions and help them apply the knowledge gained during their studies in the workplace. PS-I helps students nurture their professional, cognitive, and technical skills and host organizations by the enthusiastic participation and contribution of students to their ongoing work at their working premises. PS-I is monitored and evaluated by a resident faculty, who conducts the program, in consultation with the host organization coordinator. PS-I faculty is ably supported by student co-instructors and faculty co-instructors in operational and technical aspects, respectively. Keeping the largest interest of wider knowledge dissemination, PSD is happy to bring forth the second edition of the PS-I Chronicles featuring over 1800 articles from PS-I students sharing their experiences during summer 2021. The basic premise behind the release of PS-I Chronicles is to document the PS-I learning experience of students keeping the below objectives in view. 1. To provide more information on the learning experiences by immediate senior students and PS-I faculty about stations, thereby enlightening the student community's learning opportunity. 2. To provide the faculty with enhanced information about the type and nature of work carried out at the organization. 3. To transform the knowledge gained at the organization into classroom teaching and identify the scope of deepening the collaborations with the organization. The articles have been classified into five categories based on the industry domain. Chronicle 1: Information Technology Chronicle 2: Electronics Chronicle 3: Chemical, Mechanical, Cement, Textile, Steel, and Infrastructure Chronicle 4: Health Care and others Chronicle 5: Finance and Management PSD hopes that these PS-I chronicles will help every reader acknowledge the type of work done by students in PS-I and provide the necessary feedback path to bridge the industry-academia gap. The chronicles are a must-read for prospective PS-I Students as this will help understand the work that is happening at various PS I Stations. It will also help the student to identify his/her interest and hence enhance the scope of making an informed choice while filling the preference forms for PS-I. The third edition of the PS-I chronicles is available at the following link: Thank you Prof. Gaikwad Anil Bhanudas Associate Dean, PSD, Pilani campus
Label: Intern/Placement

body: Dear Students, Greetings from Project Expository! Project Expository is an initiative under the Training Unit that aims to provide relevant placement-related data and resources to help students develop their skills and guide them through the placement season. This is to notify the students that the *Placement Statistics from the session 2020-21* for undergraduates have been made available on the Expository. This includes a branch-wise distribution of the companies that visited our campus along with the number of offers made and other relevant data. The data for post-Graduate students will be made available soon. You can access the UG statistics here < (Access via BITS Mail) For any access issues, you can contact Manasvi Singh (+91-8860074510) Thank you, Team Expository. _____________________________________________________________________ Warm regards, Tabir Mishra *Senior Manager - Placements*
Label: Intern/Placement

body: Dear Students, *Tata Group* for the first time has opened the doors of *Tata Administrative Services (TAS)*, an IAS equivalent of the private sector via *Tata Imagination Challenge < to all the students across domains. *TAS*, Tata Group's flagship leadership development program, was conceived by the legendary JRD Tata in 1956 as an elite service of young managers when he observed that there were people with impressive business acumen, but were limited by education or experience. Today the Tata Group has 30 companies in over 100+ countries and TAS Managers are leading it at every front and now they have opened their doors again to hire TAS Managers of batch 2022. *Link to Apply:* *Eligibility: *Every student enrolled in a full-time course across India and across domains - Engineering, Business, Arts, Commerce, Science, CA, etc. Apply now < if you think you can be that leader who can take the Tata group to greater heights because the Tata group is more than a company and TAS is more than just a job. Best, Team TIC _______________________________________________________________________________ Warm regards, Tabir Mishra *Senior Manager - Placements*
Label: Intern/Placement

body: Dear Students, The P&G Technical Games is back with a brand new challenge designed to test your Leadership Skills across Engineering, Manufacturing and Data Science! This year, the challenge goes live on 24th October 2021 across all participating campuses. This challenge will be the most real-time case study that you would have participated in. The case consists of 10 Multiple Choice Questions that you will have to solve within an hour! Exciting prizes, PPIs and rewards are up for grabs for the winners. Register NOW with in teams of 3 members on link: Last date for registration is October 23, 2021 ________________________________________________________________ Warm regards, Tabir Mishra *Senior Manager - Placements*
Label: Intern/Placement

body: *NOTICE* I am reaching out to you regarding Applied Science internship opportunities in the domain of Machine Learning (ML) at Amazon. Through the 2022 internship program, Amazon is looking for interns who are deeply passionate about machine learning, who aspire to build new customer experience leveraging state-of-the-art techniques in various fields of natural language processing, speech recognition, computer vision, and machine learning and/or data science in general. As interns, students will get an opportunity to dive deep into hard technical problems and come up with novel solutions that can improve the customer experience in a meaningful way. They will work on complex real-world e-commerce problems in a team of highly skilled ML scientists. Interns will be expected to work with large-scale data, formulate scientific hypothesis to help solve customer pain-points, experiment to validate their ideas, and contribute to the overall impact of the solution. *Role: *Applied Scientist Intern *Locations: *Bangalore, Hyderabad, Chennai *Internship Duration & Timeline:* *Internship Timeline: *The duration of the internship is 5-6 months (minimum duration is 5 months) and the internship can begin during any month starting January 2022 based on availability of selected interns. *Mode of Internship: *Virtual/in office based on the return to office guideline at Amazon *Stipend:* INR 90,000 per month for Bachelors, Integrated Masters, Masters and INR 120,000 for PhDs *Eligibility criteria:* Students pursuing Bachelor=E2=80=99s, Integrated Master=E2=80=99s, Master= =E2=80=99s or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operations Research, Statistics or related fields and who will graduate in the year of 2022 or 2023 are eligible to apply. The availability of candidates to do internship should be such that their internship completes prior to their graduation. *Application Process: * Please feel free to nominate the students and we will get in touch with them. They can also directly apply by following the steps given below - Step 1 - Job description and application - Interested candidates to apply by following the job link (before November 20, 2021) Step 2 - Candidates must also fill this survey < to help us understand more about their profile All students are encouraged to apply to this opportunity (before November 20, 2021) *Selection Process: * Stage 1 - Resume Review Stage 2 - Interviews *Post-internship Opportunities: *Interns will have a chance to receive a pre-placement offer (PPO) based on their performance during internship.
Label: Intern/Placement

Sometimes not just because you weren’t selected for the same role but because you didn’t even apply for it. We present to you the biggest Hiring Challenge of the Tata Group till now. Through this challenge, the Tata Group will be hiring students straight out of colleges for leadership roles in over 30+ companies, including Tata Consultancy Services, Tata Steel, Jaguar, Tata Power, and Taj Hotels. body: Dear Catalyst, Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses and a Fortune 5 company, brings you Season 3 of the Stratethon. This challenge enables you to serve a larger purpose of building healthier communities by leveraging technology and new-age solutions. Float it among the students for them to grab their chance to step up and pitch harder than they ever have. Open to B-Schools and E-Schools across India, Philippines, Singapore, Hong Kong, Vietnam, and Malaysia, Stratethon Season 3 will help you leave your mark on a global scale. Eligibility Criteria: This challenge is open to full-time 2-year MBA/PGDM students from a select list of B-Schools and full-time B.Tech/B.E. students from select engineering colleges, across specializations. Rewards & Prizes: The finalists to receive Pre-Placement Interviews (*subject to Terms & Conditions) at Optum. The regional winners from the Business and Engineering track will get prize money worth $6700 each. The regional runners-up from the Business and Engineering track will get prize money worth $3000 each. All college winners to receive certificates. Register Now: It is time to balance the scales of the health care sector. Bring your ‘A’ game to do your life’s best work.℠ Best, Team Optum
Label: Intern/Placement

body: Hi Changemaker, Tata group for the first time has opened the doors of Tata Administrative Services (TAS), an IAS equivalent of the private sector via Tata Imagination Challenge to all the students across domains. TAS, Tata group's flagship leadership development program, was conceived by the legendary JRD Tata in 1956 as an elite service of young managers when he observed that there were people with impressive business acumen, but were limited by education or experience. Today the Tata Group has 30 companies in over 100+ countries and TAS Managers are leading it at every front and now they have opened their doors again to hire TAS Managers of batch 2022. Link to Register: Eligibility: Every student enrolled in a full-time course across India and across domains - Engineering, Business, Arts, Commerce, Science, CA, etc. Apply now if you think you can be that leader who can take the Tata group to greater heights, who can add to their strength, as the Tata group is looking for more than those who just fit role titles and descriptions but want to #SettleForMore because the Tata group is more than a company and TAS is more than just a job. All the best! Regards, Team Dare2Compete
Label: Intern/Placement

body: Dear Students, Hope this email finds you well! This year, the Aditya Birla Group is hosting an online event to interact with the young talent who are on their journey to graduate from engineering courses. *Aditya Birla Group Engineering Leadership Programs*, along with *InsideIIM= *, would be conducting first ELP Konversations Caf=C3=A9 Online Event 2021, wh= ere 3rd and 4th year students from various engineering colleges & universities would be able to have their queries solved in an online session. This is a great platform for them to interact with us and understand our culture, careers, and more. There is a panel discussion scheduled on Wednesday, 20th October between 5:30 PM to 7:00 PM where some of our ABG ELP alumni would be connecting with 3rd and 4th year students for a candid conversation. All students need to do is to *register here - < Get to know the ABG ELP leaders who will be present in the event and their journeys by watching these Konversations. How A Career As A Process Engineer Looks like? < How This Mechanical Engineer Turned Into a Successful Sales Manager, Ft. Prachi Goyal < Can Your Engineering Degree In Textile Land You At A Dream Company? < Must Know Career Options For A Chemical Engineer < The final online event is on 20th October at 5:30 PM, the link to join the session will be shared on 18th October, 2021. Regards, Placement Team
Label: Intern/Placement

body: RazorPay, MPL, 1mg, Treebo, Zupee, Expedia, MX Player Hi there! Looking for an amazing internship that will help you build a great career? We understand that finding these opportunities during the pandemic is not easy; we at Upraised are here to make it accessible for you. Our Embark Program not only upskills you with industry-relevant skills but also provides you with a guaranteed internship. Get a chance to work in exciting roles at cool start-ups such as RazorPay, Clevertap, MPL, 1mg, Treebo, Zupee, Expedia, MX Player. Registrations close tomorrow (15th October) at 5:00 PM, the mock test is available today and tomorrow between 6:00 PM - 6:30 PM. Leaders such as Vijay Shekar Sharma (Founder, PayTM), Ankur Warikoo (Founder, ), Vidit Aatrey (CEO, Meesho), Malini Agarwal (Founder, MissMalini), Tanmay Bhat (Youtuber, investor) have partnered with us to bring this placement program to you. Hear directly from Vijay Shekhar Sharma “India has a large pool of youngsters that need training to build  great careers. Excited to support Upraised as they upskill students & get them internships at startups!! I encourage all students to participate” Click here to access internships with stipends [ Program Details: * Stipend: INR 15000-70000 per month. Min 15000 p.m. is assured. Guaranteed internship for all 300 selected participants (selected through ESAT –- Embark Skills Assessment Test) * Roles: Product Management, Analytics, Design, Business Operations, and People Operations * Fees: No Fees. Zero charges throughout the process * Companies: RazorPay, MPL, 1mg, Treebo, Zupee, Expedia, MX Player, and many more! * Internship Period: Based on your academic calendar, you can opt for one of the two options with a chance to convert it into a full-time job * Two month's summer internship (May / June / July 2022) * Six month's internship (Jan 2022 - June 2022) * All remote / Work From Home. * Total openings: 300 across the five verticals mentioned above * ESAT round 1: 17th October, 10:30 PM - 1:00 PM Eligibility: Pre-final year and final year students of all specializations (3rd-year students in dual degree programs are also eligible). How would this benefit you? Hear from our Founder, Mona Gandhi [ When you work with a high-growth start-up, you will experience high ownership and greater responsibilities, which provides you with a steep learning curve, setting you up for career success. You will also learn how a business functions. Next steps: To participate in the Upraised Embark Program, please register on the website [ by 5:00 PM tomorrow (final deadline). We hope to see you at Embark 2021! Thanks, Krishna Kedia E: care.embark@upraised.co [care.embark@upraised.co] signature [ Click here to unsubscribe [
Label: Intern/Placement

Here's calling out all the Engineering and B-School Students willing to ride into a brighter future dotted with possibilities. Best Regards, Team Hero MotoCorp Limited

body: For Freshers and Experienced! ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ The Indian IT sector as a whole has been at such a fast pace industry in its growth and development. However, in terms of employment, job demands, and influential opportunities, some cities have been the hub for job aspirants. Some of the cities where the heart of the IT industry lies are – Bengaluru, Karnataka (known as the silicon valley of India) Pune, Maharashtra Hyderabad Gurgaon, Haryana New Delhi Chennai, Tamil Nadu Mumbai, Maharashtra Noida, Uttar Pradesh These cities have, with time, broadened the horizon of the tech industry by opening up many interesting and latest job positions for the tech aspirants. There are many factors that affect one job profile’s salary like experience, job roles, location, employer, skillset. Below is given the average base salary for the highest paid jobs in India based on experience – Job Profile Average Base Salary/ year (In INR) Fresher Salary/year Experienced Salary/year Software Development Engineer ₹1,191,752 ₹989,044 ₹2,225,470 Data Scientist ₹824,241 ₹539,654 ₹1,753,819 Data Engineer ₹839,625 ₹464,722 ₹1,878,772 Software Architect ₹2,199,698 ₹977,473 ₹3,138,870 Cloud Architect ₹1,796,392 ₹409,634 ₹2,313,443 Blockchain Engineer ₹808,000 ₹6,26,185 ₹3,675,000 DevOps Engineer ₹715,281 ₹391,646 ₹1,776,410 IoT Solutions Architect ₹1,915,175 ₹496,349 ₹2,095,967 Artificial Intelligence Engineer ₹750,000 ₹606,782 ₹1,813,892 Product Manager ₹1,739,231 ₹919,024 ₹2,118,330 Software Development Engineer A software development engineer is a technical professional who is responsible for creating applications and software programs that can be run on different platforms and operating systems. There is a great demand for this job profile amongst many big tech giants like TCS, Udemy, Amazon, etc. Key Highlights of the Job Role Valued job position in the tech industry. One of the highest paying jobs. The opportunity for great learning. Work with some great companies in the industry. Know More   Blockchain Engineer Blockchain is the leading technology for the Banking and Finance Sector. And a professional expert to manage and handle the entire infrastructure of the blockchain technology, employers hire a blockchain engineer. It is among the high-salary jobs in India because of the rising demand for Bitcoin and Etherium. Blockchain technologies have opened up infinite possibilities for aspirants as well as employers. Key Highlights of the Job Role High demand but Limited Workforce. Working on the latest technology. Great tech giants are hiring Blockchain Engineers. Leading job position. Data Scientist Data Scientist is a job position that requires expertise in scientific analyzing and interpreting of Big Data. Big Data is a large set of information/ data that cannot be analyzed with the traditional techniques of data processing. This is where comes the Data Scientist. Key Highlights of the Job Role High Demand in every industry. According to the Higher growth and learning rate. The scope of the job role is flourishing. Cloud Architect A cloud Architect is responsible for the design, architect, implementation, and maintenance of the cloud computing components. Cloud computing is broad network access that allows delivery for services like storage, networking, database, servers, analytics over the internet without any human interaction. Key Highlights of the Job Role In-demand skills or roles by employers. Scale up your career growth and learning. One of the Trendiest job in IT Industry. An excellent option for freshers. To know more about the other 8 job profiles click on the button below: Know More Copyright © 2021 Scaler.com, All rights reserved You are getting this mail because your e-mail ID is registered with us. To stop receiving these mails click- Unsubscribe .
Label: Intern/Placement

body: Dear Catalysts, Optum Stratethon Season 3 is here and it is time to get your game on! Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses and a Fortune 5 company, brings you Season 3 of the Stratethon. This challenge enables you to serve a larger purpose of building healthier communities by leveraging technology and new-age solutions. This is your chance to step up and pitch harder than you ever have. Open to B-Schools and E-Schools across India, Philippines, Singapore, Hong Kong, Vietnam, and Malaysia, Stratethon Season 3 will help you leave your mark on a global scale. Eligibility Criteria: This challenge is open to full-time 2-year MBA/PGDM students from a select list of B-Schools and full-time B.Tech/B.E. students from select engineering colleges, across specializations. Rewards & Prizes: The regional winners from the Business and Engineering track will get prize money worth $6700 each. The regional runners-up from the Business and Engineering track will get prize money worth $3000 each. The finalists to receive Pre-Placement Interviews (*subject to Terms & Conditions) at Optum. All college winners to receive certificates. Register Now: It is time to balance the scales of the health care sector. Bring your ‘A’ game to do your life’s best work.℠ Best, Team Optum
Label: Intern/Placement

body: tps-notification We are pleased to inform you that JSW has tied hands with World Stee= l Association on their steelChallenge-16 competition. This yearly competiti= on is recognised by the global steel community as the preeminent competitio= n to engage students and industry professionals to showcase their abil= ity to make the best quality steel at lowest cost.  This is a brillian= t opportunity to find and nurture talent for the steel industry and needles= s to say is a great opportunity for the participants to learn and grow= .The World Steel Association opened registration for the 16th editi= on of steelChallenge. steelChallenge is the biggest steel industry competit= ion where students and industry employees can test their skills using the s= ophisticated online process simulations delivered by steeluniversity. = New this year, there will be carbon footprint requiremen= ts for the steel grade to reinforce the steel industry commitment to reduce= the footprint from its operations. steelC= hallenge-16 will take place over two rounds. The Regional Championship will= take place online on 24 November 2021 = from 5.30 PM. Participants will use a combin= ation of the Electric Arc Furnace and the Secondary Steelmaking simulators,= producing the required steel at the lowest cost.  They will be asked = to produce steel and refine it to the proper chemistry and temperature.= The finalists for the World Championship will include the top student in= each of the following regions:Americas,Asia – E= ast and Oceania,Asia – North,Asia – West, and= Europe and Africa. The World Championship= will be in April 2022.All participants successfully completing a si= mulation run will get an official completion certificate by st= eeluniversity. In addition, when registering for the competition, = participants will get a full pack of learning resources including e-learnin= g courses, 3D interactive models and practice simulations.The Region= al Champions will receive a cash prize, a regional championshi= p certificate and the invitation to the World Ch= ampionship. They will also gain recognition as the gl= obal industry’s promising new generation of metallurgists&nb= sp;and will be featured on the steeluniversity website. The World Champions will get the steelChallenge trophy and r= eceive an additional cash prize and a certificate.__ JSW will also give out certificates, merchandise and goodies = for each student who registered and appeared for the challenge! Hurry Up!&n= bsp; Participation is absolutely free. Par= ticipants can register for steelChallenge-16 now at steeluniversity.org. Ste= ps to register are attached below. Through our partnership we have been abl= e to give out free promo codes to interested participants which will exempt= them from paying for the challenge. Please also find attached below t= he promo codes to register and participate. The promo codes are to be = filled in during the registration process. More information abo= ut steelChallenge-16 is available at /steeluniversity.org/steelchallenge-16 =20 =20 =09 See Notice in App *** This is a sy= stem generated email. Please do not reply to this email. *** You are receiving this email because you have subscribed to our list. body: At *Isolern* < we're dedicated to giving you the best industry experience while you're studying in college. And since our launch in June, we've successfully helped over 45 students get their dream internships, but we've also observed that many of you were not able to apply to these internships. Today, we've come up with a solution for you. We know you are busy, and so, unlike Internshala and LinkedIn, we do not want you to apply to each company individually. From now on, *all you have to do is register on Isolern < and complete your profile to get your dream internship.* And our intelligent AI algorithms will find the companies that you're a fit for and automatically apply to all of them. You'll be notified only when a company is interested in you and wants to interview you. Yes, it is that simple. What are you waiting for? Register on *Isolern* < now! (It's *FREE*) (We highly recommend using a PC while completing your profile.) In case of any query/ suggestions to improve *Isolern* < feel free to reach out to us. Paresh Deshmukh - 8830631677 (Call/WhatsApp) Arpit Anshuman - 9829775537 (Call/WhatsApp)
Label: Intern/Placement

body: ***Intended for 2023 Graduating Students Only*** Dear Students, You must have received a registration invite mail from Superset (Placement Unit Portal) with the subject "*2023 Passout Placement Registration*". The guideline for registering on the portal is attached below. Please follow it and begin registering only after going through it once carefully. *Kindly note that all the students are supposed to join the slack < ttps%3A%2F%2Fjoin.slack.com%2Ft%2Finternshipsea-i1j8669%2Fshared_invite%2Fz= t-sz3g664n-xo4pcVyvqI7cZD6~p0pPUg> group as a FIRST STEP* and then only proceed with registration on superset. Post your *queries *regarding the portal if any on the* #internship-queries* thread only. The* #announcement* thread is strictly for announcements from the PU team and no queries should be posted there. *Please note that it is compulsory for all the 2023 graduating students to register in the portal using the registration link sent to you. Kindly note that this is the registration for the Placement Portal which will be used for all the communications from the Placement Unit regarding your Placements as well as Internship season.* Also, Kindly note that the CGPA cutoff for the internship season will be decided based on the data we receive from the portal registration. We are in the discussion stage regarding the same. A final announcement about the Internship season CGPA cutoff will be announced through the portal after the registration is complete. For queries and issues, please reach out to us in the slack group. *The deadline for registration is 9 PM, 26 July 2021. * Warm regards, *Sanskriti Jindal* Email: Personal E-mail , University E-mail Phone- +91-8826640597 *=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84= =E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2= =96=84=E2=96=84**=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2= =96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96= =84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84**=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96= =84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84= =E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84=E2=96=84* *Birla Institute of Technology & Science,* *Pilani* Pilani Campus, Rajasthan - 333 031, INDIA. body: tps-notification Dear Product Aspirants,Are you preparing for your first product interview? Are y= ou finding it difficult to see the immense amount of PM prep materials avai= lable but not knowing where to start? We are here for you. We, PM Buddy, is= a volunteer-led group of significantly experienced Senior Product Managers= trying to accelerate your Product journeys. All the mentors have at least = 5+ years of core Product Management experience and have hired multiple APMs= /PMs in their careers.PM Buddy is delighted to bri= ng you two programs, a Bootcamp focussed on Cracking Product Management int= erviews and a Mock Interview and Mentorship platform where you can partner = up with experienced Product managers to do 1-on-1 product mock interviews. = Both the programs were created with the sole purpose of helping students cr= ack their first product job. Please refer to the individual sections below = to know more about each of these programs.Program = 1 -  Cracking Product Management interviews BootcampWe understand that preparing for PM interviews is unstructured and= complex - especially when you are appearing for your first Product Managem= ent interview. So, how would you differentiate yourself from the several ot= her candidates? This Bootcamp aims to prepare you for just that and provide= you with a structured approach to cracking Product interviews. This is a c= ondensed course that is very specific and focused on interviews and is grea= t for anyone appearing for PM interviews in the next few weeks or months. T= his will help you in product management interviews in your target companies= such as Flipkart, Ola, CRED, Axis Bank, etc. The course is structured and = timed in such a way that you will be ready by the time on-campus APM roles = and off-campus product intern roles open up.What d= o we offer - Learning from expe= rienced Product Managers with ~ 8+ years of experience in product and exper= tise in hiring APMs and Junior PMsP= roduct portfolio building and mentorship sessions Lifetime access to a community of like-minded people an= d experienced PMsHow is this course different = -The course is delivered by mentors = who have been hiring APMs, junior and senior PMs for a few years now and th= ey bring in several years of industry experienceThe course focuses on structured interview prep that will help= you learn and apply in your interviews very wellMore details about the course are attached in the brochure.<= /p>Course dates - 2nd(Sat) and 3rd(Sun) = Oct 2021Duration - 12 hours totalRegistration link - />RP4RxRTsGnKMxCQU6<= /li>Registration Deadline - By Wednesday, Se= pt 28th night at 11:59 PMThe details of paymen= ts are as mentioned below -Pack 1= BootcampRs. 2249/-<= td>Payment LinkPack 2 *Bootcamp + 1-1 product deck review/re= sume review (1 hour)Rs. 2999/-Payment LinkPack 3 *<= /p>Bootcamp + 1-1 product interview and feedback (1= hour)Rs. 2999/-P= ayment LinkPack 4 *Bootcamp + 1-1 product deck review/resume review (1 hour)+ 1-1= product interview and feedback (1 hour)Rs. 350= 0/-Payment Link* There are limited slots for Packs 2, 3, a= nd 4, and hence book immediately if you need 1x1 assistance. Mentors will b= e assigned on booking.Register here and complete the payment for the pack you are intereste= d in using the payment link for the respective pack mentioned above.You can also watch a demo mock interview session taken by= Premanku, one of our mentors here. You can check our LinkedIn page here and our YouTube channel here. If you would lik= e to learn more about the program or chat with one of the mentors, please d= rop an email to connect.pmbuddy@gmail.com.&nbs= p;Program 2 -  1-on-1 Product Mock Interview and Me= ntorship PlatformAre you preparing for your first = APM interview? Do you feel like doing a mock interview with an experienced = PM and getting your answers reviewed by them? Well, we are here for you! PM= Buddy Mock Interview Platform does exactly that and more. We have created = this platform with the intention to help all the aspiring PMs, especially f= rom the student community to achieve their first product job. We are a volunteer-led group of significantly experienced = Senior Product Managers trying to accelerate your Product journeys. All the= mentors have at least 5+ years of core Product Management experience and h= ave hired multiple APMs/PMs in their careers.How d= oes this work?Complete the registration and paymen= t of Rs 1000 here for one mock interview. Men= tion which type of mock interview you want to take in the form. Once you re= gister, we will reach out to you and will allot an experienced PM for your = preferred time slot. This platform is specifically focused and designed for= undergraduate students who are interviewing for their first APM Role.<= br />Registration and payment page - />PMBuddyMockInterviews = Watch a few of our previous mock interviews at - it.ly/PMBuddyFor any queries reach out to us @= connect.pmb= uddy@gmail.com.Thanks!Team = PM Buddy  <= /div> Attachments : Click on the link to download =09PM Buddy Mock Interview Platfo= rm.pdf =09PM Buddy Bootcamp Brochure_2.p= df =20 =20 =09 See Notice in App *** This is a sy= stem generated email. Please do not reply to this email. *** You are receiving this email because you have subscribed to our list. To Superset #2724, Level 3, 31st Main, 16th Cross HSR Layout, Bangalore, 560102 © 2019 GreekTurtle.

body: Dear Students, This is for your information. Thanks & Regards Dean AUGS ---------------------------------------------------------------------------= -------------- Dear Student, After the huge success of the inaugural batch of the *Applied Deep Learning internship*, we are back this December! *Inviting all applicants* who missed out on the internship due to the limited number of seats in the inaugural batch, to enroll for the internship. This LIVE online internship enables you to apply your knowledge of Deep Learning to solve real-world problems and work on innovative projects mentored directly by *HPE's industry experts and trainers.* *Internship takeaways:* 1. Work on industry projects in Python, TensorFlow and Keras to deepen real-world understanding 2. Design your Neural Network from scratch 3. Learn advanced Deep Learning applications: Regularization methods, Hyper Parameter Tuning, Time Series Analysis 4. Design and deploy deep learning solutions in Computer Vision (CV) and Natural Language Processing (NLP) 5. Simulate industry project team scenario and get trained on DevOps Azure *It=E2=80=99s crucial to have an edge in recruitment, or when you=E2=80=99r= e applying for your masters. Here=E2=80=99s a look at some of our alumni.* 1. *Anubha Kabra*, a graduate of *Delhi Technological University (DTU)*, is currently working as a *software engineer at Adobe*. Read more about her journey here < nship-india> . 2. Sarthak Goel, a graduate from *Birla Institute of Technology and Science Pilani (BITS Pilani), Goa *is currently working as an analyst at Goldman Sachs. 3. *Shaolin Kataria, *a graduate of *VIT, Vellore*, shares his experience of *interning at NUS*. You can get to know more about it here= . < experience> *Schedule: * 1. *The HPEDL LIVE Online starts Mid December 2021 * 2. *8-weeks *with LIVE sessions over *Wednesday and Saturday (4 hours each) * 3. * Internship Fee- 799 SGD Only * Please refer to the attached brochure for further reference. Feel free to write back for any queries. If you want to enroll, for the internship click here. < To INQUIRE, for the internship click here < m/formperma/hA5EQjQmcNH3SwOhEEBz4CGHd2PRhG0Zk03s5BrQlyw> . See y'all there! Kind Regards Divya Radhakrishnan Business Leader Graduate Leadership Academy Corporate Gurukul Singapore | India | UAE www.corporategurukul.com | *divya.radhakrishnan@corporategurukul.com *
Label: Intern/Placement

body: Greetings from CEL, BITS Pilani! We are glad to share with you an internship opportunity at *CleverTap**.* H= ere is a brief description for the same: ************************** CleverTap < empowers digital brands to increase customer retention and lifetime value with the help of data, personalization, deep-tech, and automation. We work with thousands of brands globally, including *Dream 11, Dunzo, Lenskart, Zomato, Pharmeasy, MX Player, Premier League, and GO-JEK*. CleverTap is backed by Sequoia Capital, Accel, and Tiger Global. Headquartered in Mountain View, US, our 350+ CTzens work out of Mumbai, Singapore, Dubai, and other locations globally. We=E2=80=99re one of the fastest-growing SaaS startups in the marketing technology space. CleverTap is *Great Place to Work-Certified*=E2=84=A2 and has been named Forbes=E2=80= =99 Best Startup Employer in America for 2 years in a row - 2020 and 2021. We are looking for an engineering mindset that brings fresh ideas from various areas, including large-scale platform design, analytics, data structures, security practices, large-scale data retrieval, and processing environments. We are initiating our *hiring process* for freshers in our engineering team by collaborating with premier colleges. We are launching this by collaborating with BITS - Hyderabad, Goa, and Pilani campuses. The interested applicants would go through a screening process of aptitude and technical test followed by a personal interview. The module for the internship would be in two phases: *Phase I:* *2-month internship* The interns in this phase would be associated with us for a span of 2 months starting from *October 1, 2021, until November 30, 2021*, with a stipend of 25,000 INR per month. Based on their performance, feedback, and internal assessment, we would offer them a Full-time internship along with PPO, in the subsequent phase. (More details for Phase II in the document attached below). *Why join us?* - Be a part of a global growth-stage startup - Work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment where your contribution matters - You are passionate about technology and its impact on the high growth mobile technology space - Innovate at scale, with learning opportunities To know more about the tech stack and the key responsibilities, please visit these links: Backend < | Frontend < To apply for this internship, please drop a mail to Vaibhav@CleverTap.com a= long with your CV/Resume. **************************** Best Regards, Nikhil Bhamwani Lead, Summer in a Startup < Center for Entrepreneurial Leadership, BITS Pilani +91- 846 982 6690
Label: Intern/Placement

body: Dear Students, Greetings from Project Expository! Project Expository < is an initiative under the Placement Unit that aims at creating guidance pathways for students. To tackle the lack of knowledge about the core fields of engineering, we have decided to embark upon creating more awareness by curating a series of recorded podcasts of students who have interned/got placed at prestigious firms in the core sector. To begin with, we have recorded two podcasts with BITSians who have bagged exceptional offers in the fields of ET and Mechanical core. In the ET sector, we have esteemed speakers like Rahul (Interned at Nvidia), Piyush Raj Jha (Placed at Expressif Systems) and Ananya Khandelwal (Interned and placed at Micron Technologies). In mechanical core, we have Kanishk Chaudhary (Interned at Boston Scientific) giving his insights on the placement process. The links for the same are as attached below- 1. ET podcast < 2. Mechanical podcast < We would request you all to go through the recordings to get more insights on the internship and placement processes apart from the general overview of the respective core domains. Thank you! Team Project Expository __________________________________________________________________________
Label: Intern/Placement

body: Dear Student, Please find the necessary instructions for the online test below. *Please note: Dual degree students will fall under the master's category and must attempt the respective test accordingly.* 1. Students are required to choose an interview track for the online technical test 2. Before the start of the test, students will upload their resumes as part of the evaluation process. Please share the following links to uplo= ad the resumes: - Bachelor Intern in Engineering Development Group < 52&s_eid=3DRcv_17552> - Masters or Ph.D. Intern in Engineering Development Group < 53&s_eid=3DRcv_17553> 1. Students will get an additional 15 mins to apply to the role in our system 2. Please ask the students to read the test instructions before they start 3. Students should not toggle between windows during the test 4. Students *MUST* attempt the *coding questions*. *Test Timings* Internship : *Test starts on 20- Sep-2021 sharp @ 8:30pm and links will expire by 9:30pm (Duration: 60 minutes)* *Internship - Bachelors* Engineering EEE/ EnI * < Computer Science * < *Internship - Masters* Engineering EEE/ EnI * < Computer Science * < *Password* *polyspace* Moreover, please find the necessary information for the interview day, below: 1. *Links for preparation*: Please share the links below with the students to help them prepare well for the interview =C2=B7 MathWorks Homepage < =C2=B7 Full company overview < us/> =C2=B7 Core Values < =C2=B7 *Areas of focus for the Hyderabad EDG team include* Full-stac= k Development, Software Engineering, Cloud Computing, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Web & App Development, Algorithm Development in Autonomous Systems and Communication Systems spanning Signal Processing, Wireless, Image Processing, Computer Vision, Sensor Fusion, Radar and Lidar Processing, Automated Driving, Robotics/UAV, FPGA/HDL, Wireless Protocols (5G, WLAN, Bluetooth), SIMD Optimization, Embedded Software, Sensors/Hardware, Automatic Code Generation, EM, RF, and Antennas. =C2=B7 *Areas of focus for the Bangalore EDG team include*=E2=80=AFFu= ll-stack Development, Algorithm Development, Web Development, Automatic Code Generation, Software Engineering, Automated Driving, Agent-based Modelling, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Embedded Vision, IoT, Code Infrastructure/Architecture, Code Coverage, Numeric Solvers, Embedded Targets, Compiler Technologies, UAVs/Drones, Communication Protocols, Control Systems, Motor Control, Controls for Power Conversion, Powertrain, Hardware Platforms, System Software, Data & Image Acquisition, Vehicle Network, Developing MATLAB interfaces for other languages and Audio/Video/Image/Scientific data formats. --=20 *Regards* *Rutul Tarnekar* *Pitching HeadPlacement Unit, BITS Pilani* *Mobile- + 91-9975077810* *E-Mail:*- Personal || University Email

body: This is regarding the annual Adobe Analytics Challenge. This year the competition will again be open on a global scale and all submissions and presentations will be run virtually. Since its inception in 2005, the Adobe Analytics Challenge has grown as an international business case competition for cash prizes, internships, and full-time offers. The Challenge is a unique analytics-focused business case competition where university students are given the opportunity to use Adobe Analytics with real-world data from leading organizations. Last year over 4600 students from over 300 universities across 20 different countries competed for a huge amount in cash prizes. Attached to this email you will find some basic slides that will answer any questions that come up. Follow the self-explanatory website with registration information, key dates, and other important details at . A few important reminders: - *Registration closes on September 21**st at 11:59pm PST. *Please feel free to leverage the attached flyer and kickoff presentation to help promote to your students - Please remind students they will need a copy of their resume for registration. While this resume doesn=E2=80=99t impact the judging proce= ss, *both Adobe and our customer partner are keen to identify talent and will be recruiting heavily from this pool of applicants* - Faculty registration will remain open throughout the competition; however, *teams without an assigned faculty mentor will not be able to progress to the semifinal round* - Remind students to join the* training call on September 23**rd at either 9-11am or 4-6pm PST*. Students and faculty will access the links for these sessions on their team profile page. The recording will be mad= e available for all those who are unable to attend --=20 Dr. Yashvardhan Sharma Faculty Incharge, Information Processing Centre, BITS-Pilani
Label: Intern/Placement

body: Dear Student, Please find below online test link & password: *Date:* 17th Sept *Time:* 9:00 PM *Test Duration:* 2 hours *Link for the test (for B.E/B.Tech): < *Password:* Walmart2k22 *Note:* *Students will have only 20 mins of window to register for the test that is from 9:00 PM to 9:20 PM* Online test comprises of 100 marks of 3 Programming questions. *Test Instructions:* - Ensure that you are attempting the test using the correct email ID. - Candidates should ensure to be in full-screen mode during the test. - This test requires *mandatory webcam* either from *desktop/laptop* and no other means of devices. - Copy and paste in the code editor from external sources is not allowed. - You will be automatically logged out of the test if you cross 3 shift tabs/browser screens on your machines/laptops. There is no re-entry back into the test once logged out. - You must click *Submit* after you answer each question. - Pls read all the instructions carefully on the hacker-earth portal. - *In case of a tie, the candidate attempting more questions would be given preference (an attempt is counted if you pass at least 2 test cases), i.e. you must try to solve at least few test cases of maximum number of problems.* - *If a tie still exists, we will consider the candidate who submitted the complete test earlier.* - **If found using any other gadgets while attempting for the test, candidate will be disqualified. Regards, Placement Unit
Label: Intern/Placement

body: Dear Students, Greetings from the Placement Unit! To spread awareness about the placement preparation and process, we invite queries related to placement preparations, different domains, profile building and exit options. The questions wouldn't be answered on a case by case basis but would be compiled in a document and published by the Placement Unit. Please refrain from submitting queries regarding the specifics of the present placement and internship season. We encourage the students, especially those in their 2nd and 3rd year, to ask anything related to the abovementioned topics. The queries can be submitted in this form < For any other doubts, please get in touch with Ayush(+91 8804409700)*.* Regards, Placement Unit.
Label: Intern/Placement

body: Dear ML Summer School Participant, Hope you are safe and doing well. We have Machine Learning (ML) internship opportunities available at Amazon.= If you are interested to apply for the same, please find the details given= below - Role - Applied Scientist Intern Locations available - Bangalore, Hyderabad, Chennai Stipend - INR 90,000 Application Process Step 1 - Application link - -scientist-intern Step 2 - Survey link - vqQRg Both steps are mandatory for application. Kindly complete both steps latest= by 1:00 PM IST on September 3, 2021. Selection Process Stage 1 - Resume Review Stage 2 - Virtual Interview Round 1 on Coding (Data structures and Algorith= ms) Stage 3 - Virtual Interview Round 2 on Machine Learning Based on the resume review, interview invites will be sent to shortlisted a= pplicants for Round 1 based on the availability shared by them in the surve= y. Candidates performing well in Round 1 will only be invited for Round 2. Based on the performance during internship, there is an opportunity for int= erns to receive Pre-placement Offers (PPO) for full-time roles at Amazon. P= lease note that this is a full-time internship and can happen in office so = kindly apply for this internship only if your academic curriculum allows yo= u to do so. Thanks & Regards, AMAZON ML SUMMER SCHOOL For more information visit Amazon ML Summer School< hoolindia.splashthat.com/>

body: Greetings from the Physics Association! We invite you to a Profile Building Session with Nikita Saxena, a pre-final year M.Sc. Physics and B.E. Computer Science student from BITS Pilani, Pilani Campus. Her notable achievements include being a DAAD and CHARPAK scholar. She has also worked as an undergraduate research assistant at UC San Diego and is currently a junior investigator at IAIFI. In this session, she will be talking about: 1. How to build a strong profile 2. How to secure internships at startups (deep learning-based) 3. How to shortlist professors, universities, and projects 4. Application procedure of DAAD and CHARPAK In case you have any questions for Nikita, please fill in this Google Form: We'd also be having a live QnA session after the talk wherein attendees can pose their questions at Nikita (if any). We hope to see you there! Timing: *7 PM* Date: *2nd September 2021 (Thursday)* Meet Link: meet.google.com/hys-dieg-ofk
Label: Intern/Placement
