body: *BITS Embryo* is glad to announce *Jyothi Kalyan Sura* Award-Winning and Critically Acclaimed *Technical Director, VFX Artist and Writer* as the guest speaker for *3rd Edition* of *Being BITSian* * An online talk* Taking over the world as a celebrated *Technical Director, VFX Artist and Writer* he was once walking the same streets as you! Now, he's back to reveal the wax and wanes of his journey from BITS to Hollywood. *About the Talk: * These* interactive talks*, delivered by the *alumni*, would most definitely be a special connection to the heart of the attendees. Jyothi will talk about how a* BITSian *can make use of the *various opportunities* at the institute to catapult their profiles to be the best in what they aim to do. Though this place has evolved a lot, the core feelings and echo of the institute have remained the same over these years. Jyothi will talk about his personal experiences coupled with an informal interaction that would surely benefit all of the BITSians in continuing the legacy. He will also touch upon his career in the film industry and his roles on the celluloid. *About the Speaker:* Jyothi Kalyan Sura is a storyteller, an engineer, and a leader. His love for creative and technical storytelling led him to *DreamWorks Animation India*, where he worked as a *Technical Director (TD*) for three years on critically and commercially acclaimed films like *How To Train Your Dragon 2, Pokemon Detective Pikachu, X-men Dark Phoenix *among others. He left DreamWorks as the only TD to have an artistic demo-reel. Kalyan spent his spare time *developing* *video games, VR, Animation* and *writing fictional stories* - most notably, a 300-page fiction thriller novel, inspired by events in India. In May 2018, Kalyan completed his Master's in Film Production from USC's prestigious School of Cinematic Arts with a focus on Writing, Directing and Visual Effects. At USC, Kalyan wrote over *15 short films, two feature screenplays* and* directed five films*. He helped over 20 productions in various roles including *Sound, Editing and Visual Effects*. Kalyan also served as the *President of the Visual Effects Society of USC.* Possessing a rare blend of technical and creative skills that he can juggle with sophisticated dexterity at will, Kalyan aims to work at the intersection of storytelling and technology. If you wish to know more about the speaker, here is a link to his profile: *BITS Embryo* warmly welcomes you all! *Date of Talk: 10th August 2019* *Time : 8:00 PM* *Venue: LTC 5103 * Regards, BITS Embryo <
Label: Formal

body: Dear Students and Faculty, Centre of Innovation Incubation and Entrepreneurship (CIIE) believes in empowering the young BITSians with the spirit of leadership and innovation. We encourage them to break the conventional paradigms and follow their calling. Carrying forward this vision we are organizing a series of events where you all would be introduced to the disruptive world of BITSian startups. As our flagship event we are hosting an interactive talk session with our award-winning innovative startup Elixar Systems, and the visionary,hustling startup Pepper. *Elixar Systems* Elixar Systems was founded in the BITSian dorms by 4 stubborn creative second-yearites who dared to dream apart. Their endeavours to start using the mystical tech of Augmented Reality in education and then develop a viable business model around it has baffled corporates and government alike. Within half an year Elixar Systems has won 2 innovation summits organized at IISc Bangalore and IIT Bombay respectively and have collaborated with CSIR-CEERI and Nvidia for empowering their workforce. As a firm believer in making education experiential and visualization centric they have entered into a partnership with the largest educational body of India i.e NCERT. In collaboration with NCERT they are empowering the course-textbooks with Augmented Reality and are changing the face of education for the 260 million Indian students. The visionary and enthusiastic founders of Elixar Sashakt,Faraaz,Harshit and Shubham are indeed true examples of 'Innovate Achieve and Lead' *Pepper:* Pepper (www.pepper.org.in) is a one stop destination for content creation. We provide end to end content solutions through an AI-enabled platform. Working with a virtualised workforce of freelance writers and editors, pan globe, we are the largest curated content community in the country. We are the bridge between the freelance content creators and the brands who need them. With over 120 clients like IndiaToday, Bharat Matrimony, YourStory, Paisabazaar, Times Internet, Bewakoof, etc, we want to transform the way businesses market, the way they do social! CIIE feels immense pride in inviting the founders of Elixar Systems/Pepper and providing a platform for propelling the spirit of leadership and innovation amongst BITSians. *Venue:- NAB Audi* *Date:- 14th August, 2019* *Time:- 5:30PM* *Video Link describing Elixar Systems product:-* *Centre of Innovation Incubation and Entrepreneurship (CIIE) *
Label: Formal

body: Warm Greetings! Team APOGEE is glad to invite you to Think Again Live Talk #2 by* Dr Duvvuri Subbarao.* We hope to pique your interests in economics and leadership from the insights and experiences Dr Subbarao has collected on his incredible journey. *Date: 13th November 2021* *Time: 4:00 PM* *Topic: Leadership Lessons I Learnt the Hard Way* The talk shall be *Live-Streamed* in *NAB Audi (6110)*, seats will be available on a first-come-first-serve basis, *masks are mandatory*. You can also tune in to the online live-stream link: [image: Duvvuri.png] A glimpse into Dr Subbarao=E2=80=99s life: - Ex-Indian Administrative Service Officer and had topped the UPSC CSE in 1972 - Governor of the Reserve Bank of India (2008-2013), led India to economic recovery after the Lehman Crisis or the 2008 Global Financial Crisis. - Finance Secretary, Govt of India (2007-2008). - Humphrey Fellow, MIT and Distinguished Visiting Professor, National University of Singapore - Lead Economist, World Bank (1999-2004). In case of any queries feel free to reach out to Aishwarya (+91-7004917901) or Lavanya (+91-9903039261). Looking forward to seeing you at the talk, we hope you have a great learning experience! Regards Team APOGEE :)
Label: Formal

body: *Dear all,* *American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME) invites you to the ASME E-Fest Careers 2021 Event.* The event offers lots of opportunities for you to learn, engage, and network. It includes numerous live and on-demand sessions focusing on "Jobs of the Future". The participants can visit the virtual exhibit booths, view on-demand content, participate in the digital scavenger hunt and have some fun! The event tracks on Future Technologies, Career Readiness, Growing Industries, Professional Pathways, Soft Skills & Career Decisions, and many more. *ASME E-Fest Careers event tries to enrich the attendees with a holistic approach through:* - Women in Mech: Navigating Your Engineering Studies & Career - Renewable Energy: Powering a Sustainable Future - Breaking the Hiring Code - Mobility Transition in a Fast-Paced World - Global Keynote: Workforce Diversity & Development - Future Technologies Ask Me Anything (AMA): Clean Energy - Growing Industries Ask Me Anything (AMA): IoT/AI/Machine Learning - Virtual Interviewing - Prepare, Practice, Perfect! - Future Technologies Ask Me Anything (AMA): Robotics & Automated Systems - Growing Industries Ask Me Anything (AMA): Space - How to Build Your Brand and Go Viral on LinkedIn - STEM Keynote - Envisioning Life After High School: STEM and Biofabrication as Promising Paths Forward - Resume building - Future Engineer Tools: Building Community & A Growth Mindset - Reversing Impostor Syndrome and "Future-Proofing" Your Engineering Career - How Will You Become Your FutureME? - Engineering a Sustainable Food Chain - Entrepreneurship/Innovation: Breaking Cultural Inertia - Student Leadership Training: How to Lead Without Being in Charge - Future Engineer Tools: Powerful Personal Statements and Academic Resumes - Benefits and Opportunities of Professional Engineering Licensure - Ask Me Anything (AMA): Trayectoria Profesional - Career Path - Networking Opportunities *Why should YOU attend an ASME E-Fest Career 2021 Event?* - *Build your resume* and skill set by participating in interactive sessions and AMAs - Get *real-world advice* and intel from practicing engineers - Hear *powerful speeches* from industry experts on the *social aspects of the work culture, latest innovations* and *technology*, and *career planning* on topics such as: - Internet of Things, Artificial Intelligence, and Machine Learning - Space - Building Brand Value - Leadership Training - Interviews - Networking - Career Planning and Future-Proofing the career - Hiring Pattern Analysis As a member of the aforementioned student section, I invite you to attend the ASME E-Fest Career 2021 Event on *13th November 2021 (14:30 IST onwards). * Check out the schedule and register yourself for free at In case of any queries, please contact: Prabhav Kaula - 9999782340 Aditya Jha - 7078799901 Aditya Nair - 8547050899 Dakshata Dhariwal - 9907162960 Regards Prabhav Kaula President ASME BITS Pilani Student Section
Label: Formal

body: 11511001316_CS F301_AUG_2021 -> Forums -> Announcements -> CS F301 (PPL): Mid Semester Test CS F301 (PPL): Mid Semester Test by Vandana Agarwal . - Sunday, 24 October 2021, 7:39 AM --------------------------------------------------------------------- Please refer AUGSD Website for seating arrangements. The test details are as follows * Date: OCTOBER 29, 2021 * Day: FRIDAY * Time: 2:00 PM =E2=80=90 3:30 PM * Mode: CLOSED BOOK * Syllabus: LECTURES 1 - 18 (REFER MAIN COURSE PAGE FOR DETAILS [1]) * Weight: 35% * Marks: 105 Read the Question Paper carefully during the mid semester test.=C2=A0 Students are advised to read the question paper carefully once it is distributed to them. Students can clarify their doubts, pertaining to the question paper, during my first visit to the examination hall. The questions such as "What is expected to be written .....? How much....? What .....? Should I write this... or that....? etc. will not be answered by me. Students are expected to have gained the depth of the concepts discussed during regular lectures and are expected to answer the questions appropriately using their own wisdom. Students are advised to follow the Institute guidelines regarding maintaining Covid-19 appropriate behavior during the test. Note: The exchange of water bottles, pens, calculators etc. will strictly be not allowed during the test. body: 11491001094_CS F211 -> Forums -> Announcements -> Instructions for DSA Compre Test Instructions for DSA Compre Test by RAJYA LAKSHMI - Sunday, 23 May 2021, 5:30 PM --------------------------------------------------------------------- BIRLA INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY AND SCIENCE, PILANI CS F211 (DATA STRUCTURES AND ALGORITHMS) INSTRUCTIONS FOR COMPRE TEST Dear Student, Please read the following instructions carefully to understand the protocol for giving the DSA exam. 1.=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 The exam is open book (BUT NOT OPEN INTERNET). A= t any point in time, if the invigilator finds that you were using the Internet and browsing, your exam would be cancelled and the matter would be reported to DC. 2.=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 You would use Mettl to see the question paper an= d upload the answers. There would be 7 questions. You would solve each question on A4 size sheets, scan them with your mobile, name the file with the=C2=A0QUESTI= ON NUMBERS AND YOUR BITS ID, and upload them on mettl. Also, you would upload files on the google form (whose link would be shared during the exam). You will have to make three pdfs and upload them individually on mettl as well as on google form. Note that making pdf's take time; so start converting your written answers to pdf's as soon as it is announced. Of course, you can use gmail during this process. 3.=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 Your exam would start at sharp 9:00 AM and end a= t sharp 11:00 AM. You should stop writing at 11:00 AM. After that, you will get 10 minutes to upload the answers. WE STRICTLY REPEAT THAT DURING THESE 10 MINUTES YOU SHOULD NOT WRITE AND ONLY UPLOAD. 4.=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 You should ensure proper continuous Internet con= nectivity and other things required. The exam time would not be measured using the clock of Mettl; it would go by the physical clock. Please understand that this decision is taken so that sincere student is not penalized. There would be a penalty for each minute for a late submission. 5. Be ready to show the 360-degree view when asked by the invigilator. 6. Do not send me your files by Email as this would mean that you have not done the things on time. 7. You can use ebook or lecture slides (but certainly not lecture videos). Download them beforehand and do not open Nalanda or any other site during the exam. 9. Write your answers to the point and neatly. --------------------------------------------------------------------- Change your forum digest preferences:
Label: Academic

body: 11491001023_ECON F211 -> Forums -> Announcements -> Instruction for the Tomorrow's (21st May 2021) Comprehensive Exam Scheduled at 3 PM Instruction for the Tomorrow's (21st May 2021) Comprehensive Exam Scheduled at 3 PM by Rahul Arora . - Thursday, 20 May 2021, 3:27 PM --------------------------------------------------------------------- Dear Students, Following are the final instructions for the comprehensive exam scheduled tomorrow (21 May 2021) at 3 PM: [those who are going to appear tomorrow] * Questions are divided into three sections: Section A, Section B, Section C * All questions are compulsory * Part A contains MCQs with No Negative Marking * Part B contains descriptive/numerical-type questions from the part taught by Dr. Rahul * Part C contains descriptive/numerical-type questions from the part taught by Dr. Krishna * Navigation between sections is allowed * Calculator is allowed * For Part B and Part C, you need to write your answers in the space provided.=C2=A0You need=C2=A0NOT=C2=A0upload your answers separately and no= uploading is allowed and available. Please write the main answer in a new line and try to highlight it. We asked questions in such a way that you can manage typing. Also do not forget to explain/interpret your answer. In economics, without interpretation, a number does not have meaning. * The exam would be of 120 minutes in total. Make sure that in the 120th minute you click the submit/OK button and finish your test. * In case of any disconnection in between and time wasted because of reconnecting, extra 15 minutes (15 Maximum or the actual time if it is lesser) will be given at the end to compensate for that time loss. No more time would be given in any case. The link will be shared at 8:45 AM and the exam can be started around 8:55 AM.=C2=A0 * Mettl note down your screen activities, your activities, and activities/gadgets present in your room. So please be aware of it and be honest while giving your exam. * The exam is open book in the sense that you can refer to the slides, e-copy of the textbook during the exam, and other lecture material shared over NALANDA. Any extra material over the internet opened or seen during the exam will be eligible for a penalty in terms of marks. Remember we are looking at your screen activities also. The syllabus you all knew. The concepts taught post-mid-sem. From the game theory, you can leave the Max-min rule because that requires one class. After the exam, for your information, I would share the two-page notes on this for your learning only. All the best Rahul Arora (IC) --------------------------------------------------------------------- Change your forum digest preferences:
Label: Academic

body: 11491001095_CS F212 -> Forums -> Announcements -> Comprehensive Examination syllabus Re: Comprehensive Examination syllabus by Amit Dua . - Thursday, 13 May 2021, 7:31 PM --------------------------------------------------------------------- Dear Students The comprehensive examination is a completely open book. You are allowed to refer to the hard copy contents including book(s), notes, and other study material. In addition to this, the students are allowed to refer to the soft copy contents including slides, soft copy of text book and reference book, and other notes made in soft copy. The students are allowed to refer to the book through the BITS library portal as well. However, apart from accessing the BITS library, course Google classroom, and mettl application the student is not allowed to access any website or online content (including google, etc). Communication through any means including WhatsApp (web and mobile), e-mails (Gmail, Yahoomail, etc.), social media, mobiles (text, voice, or any way), and others are strictly prohibited. Use of Mobiles, Headphones, earphones, etc is not allowed during the examination. The question paper will be shared through the course Google classroom and proctored through mettl. The students are expected to write the answers on paper, scan them, and convert that into a single PDF file. While uploading kindly make sure that the PDF file is named after your BITS ID number. You can mail me your questions or reserve the Google meet between 1 and 2 PM for discussion of any topic related to the course. If any student is having any doubts or seeks clarification with the comprehensive examination please feel free to clarify. Best of Luck. Amit Dua --------------------------------------------------------------------- Change your forum digest preferences:
Label: Academic

body: Dear all, Despite a lot of external disturbances, it is very heartening to see almost the entire class attending lectures very sincerely. As announced earlier, there will be a lecture tomorrow (Saturday, 24/4) at 12 noon, in which we shall learn about another interesting aspect of *Prakriti* - the modes of material nature and how they dictate us to act. All but one question of the Mid-semester Test have been graded and available for you to view on Mercer-Mettl. I shall complete grading the remaining one question and update you by Monday. For now, please write down your clarifications, if any, and keep it with you; after releasing the total test score, I will ask you to submit them for recheck. The Mid-sem. Test answers can be found here < . Assignment #1 is also now graded and available on *Nalanda* for you to view. Please see these remarks < for knowing how grading was done. If you have any clarifications to seek, please fill out the Interaction Form < The average is 5.74 out of 10. Regarding evaluation components, 80 marks are for quizzes and assignments. Of these, the following were completed: Assignments #1 and #2 = 20 marks Course Quiz #1 = 15 marks Post-class activities (10) = 20 marks (2 buffers) The following are yet to be done: Assignment #3 = 10 marks Course Quiz #2 = 15 marks Assignment #3 will be held later next week. We have to schedule a date and time for the quiz. Now, having 2 more PCAs for 4 marks, and reducing the quiz to 11 marks is also possible. Give a thought about the evaluation components. If you have any suggestions, then please use the Interaction Form < Manoj Kannan

body: 11491001094_CS F211 -> Forums -> Announcements -> Instructions for Quiz to be conducted today (March 12, 2021) Instructions for Quiz to be conducted today (March 12, 2021) by Vishal Gupta . - Monday, 12 April 2021, 12:32 PM --------------------------------------------------------------------- Dear Student, Please read the following instructions carefully to understand the protocol for giving the DSA Quiz dexam. 1.=C2=A0 =C2=A0 =C2=A0The exam is open book (but not open Internet). At any= point in time, if the invigilator finds that you were using the Internet and browsing, your exam would be canceled and the matter would be reported to DC. 2.=C2=A0 =C2=A0 =C2=A0You would use Mettl to see the question paper and upl= oad the answers. You would solve all the questions on A4 size sheets, scan them with your mobile, name the file with your BITS ID, and upload it on mettl. 3.=C2=A0 =C2=A0 =C2=A0Your exam would start at sharp 5:00 PM and end at sha= rp 5:45 PM. You should stop writing at 5:45 PM. After that, you will get 5 minutes to upload the answers. I strictly repeat that during these 5 minutes you should not write and only upload. 4.=C2=A0 =C2=A0 =C2=A0You should ensure proper continuous Internet connecti= vity and other things required. The exam time would not be measured using the clock of Mettl; it would go by the physical clock. I would send announcements periodically on mettl. Please understand that this decision is taken so that sincere student is not penalized. There would be a penalty for each minute for a late submission. 5. Be ready to show the 360-degree view when asked by the invigilator. 6. Do not send me your files by Email as this would mean that you have not done the things on time. 7. You can use ebook or lecture slides (but certainly not lecture videos). Download these beforehand. 8. Test link would be shared on Nalanda before the test. You can keep Nalanda open in a tab during the test. In case of emergency (i.e. if anything goes wrong during the test), check the announcement section of Nalanda. --------------------------------------------------------------------- Change your forum digest preferences:
Label: Academic

body: 11491001095_CS F212 -> Forums -> Announcements -> Lab Quiz Re: Lab Quiz by Amit Dua . - Wednesday, 7 April 2021, 7:15 PM --------------------------------------------------------------------- Dear Students Following are few Frequently asked questions that I have answered at Google classroom as well FAQ: Is the test Open Book? Reply: The Test is OB and you are allowed to access your printed books and soft copy of the lab sheets and book. However, access to the Internet for solution search/access is forbidden. FAQ: How will the question be shared? Reply: The questions will be shared with you over the Mettl platform tomorrow at 11: AM. FAQ: It is necessary to submit our answer sheet as a zip file, can we submit a SQL file as there is a single file to be submitted? Reply: You need to submit only the .sql file containing SQL scripts. No other file is expected to be submitted. You are required to submit the file at the following google forms link. The same has been attached at the google classroom attachments. You are not required to join the regular Google meet link. All the necessary files are at the course Google classroom. All the best. -Amit Dua --------------------------------------------------------------------- Change your forum digest preferences:
Label: Academic

body: Dear Students, On the coming Tuesday (6th April 2021) instead of having a tutorial class, you have to complete the take-home reading assignment which will be discussed by the instructor on 7th April during the regular class. There will be no separate tutorial classes on Tuesday instead you have to read the attached material in detail and attend the regular class on 7th April. It is mandatory and suggested to come to the class on 7th April with a thorough reading so that you are able to give answers to the questions by the instructor and can effectively participate in the discussion. After having the discussion, the regular class will continue. The material is uploaded on the NALANDA course page. I am again attaching it with this email for your ready reference. The other regular classes will continue as per the schedule. Also, on your queries on Mid-Sem Marks, we will display to you soon. The evaluation is in progress. The tut-test 3 marks will be shown to you by today evening. All the best -- Dr. Rahul Arora Assistant Professor of Economics, Department of Economics and Finance, *Birla Institute of Technology & Science,* Pilani Pilani Campus, Vidya Vihar, Pilani 333031, Rajasthan, India *Phone (O)*: +91 1596 51 5758 *Phone (M)*: +91 7607481292 *Email*: rahul.arora@pilani.bits-pilani.ac.in / rahulphdeco@gmail.com *Webpage*:
